traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage
traits.description: The octopus’s Stealth is 18 while underwater.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.description: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 11), if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the octopus can’t use its Tentacles on another target.

reactions.name: Ink Dash (Recharge 6)
reactions.description: When a creature the octopus can see deals damage to it, the octopus can release a 5-foot-radius cloud of ink all around itself, if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured until the end of the octopus’s next turn, although a significant current can disperse the ink. Then, the octopus can swim up to its swimming speed. If it does so, it immediately releases any creature it is grappling.

actions.name: Angry Mob (1/Day)
actions.description: The commoner moves up to half its speed toward a creature it can see. Each friendly commoner within 30 feet of the commoner can use its reaction to join the angry mob and move up to half its speed toward the same target. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions. If the initiating commoner is within 5 feet of the target, the target must make a DC 10 FIT save, taking 1 hit of bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each commoner after the first that participated in the angry mob and that is within 10 feet of the target, the damage increases by 1 as stones, clubs, sticks, and similar "weapons" fly at the target from all angles. Afterwards, each commoner after the first that participated in the mob can’t use Angry Mob until it finishes a short or long rest.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: The raven can mimic simple sounds it has heard, such as a chord of a flute melody, a baby crying, or an animal chittering. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 10 WIL (Insight) check.

traits.name: Recollection
traits.description: The raven knows up to 20 words in any language it has heard and can repeat those words in the voices it heard them, using its Mimicry trait.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 13 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the crab attaches to the target. While attached, the crab can’t attack, and at the start of each of the crab’s turns, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. The attached crab moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the crab’s movement. It can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the crab.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the shrieker remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary fungus.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The shrieker is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Thunderous Burst
actions.description: The shrieker emits a concentrated burst of sound at one creature it can sense within 30 feet of it. The target must make a DC 10 FIT save, taking 1 hit of thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Shriek
bonus_actions.description: The shrieker emits a high-pitched shriek audible within 300 feet of it. Each creature within 30 feet of it that isn’t a Plant and that can hear the shriek must succeed on a DC 10 WIL save or be frightened until the shriek ends. The shrieker must use a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue shrieking. It can stop shrieking at any time. The shriek ends if the shrieker is incapacitated.  	 A frightened creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature that successfully saves is immune to the frightened effect of this shrieker’s Shriek for the next 24 hours.

reactions.name: Startled Shriek
reactions.description: When bright light or a creature other than a Plant moves to within 30 feet of the shrieker, the shrieker can use Shriek, if it isn’t already shrieking.

Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 10 FIT save or contract shriveling fever disease, named for the way the disease causes an infected creature’s muscles to shrivel. Until the disease is cured, the creature is poisoned, and at the end of each long rest, the infected creature must succeed on a DC 10 FIT save or its FIT score is reduced by 1d4. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. If the disease reduces the creature’s FIT to 0, the creature dies. A creature that succeeds on two saves recovers from the disease.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The crimson jelly can move through space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Blood Sense
traits.description: The crimson jelly can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that aren’t Constructs or Undead and that don’t have all of their HP within 60 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

traits.name: Ooze Nature
traits.description: The crimson jelly doesn’t require sleep.

traits.name: Ooze Resilience
traits.description: The crimson jelly is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

traits.name: Tainted Attacks
traits.description: A creature that is reduced to 0 HP by a crimson jelly must succeed on a DC 9 WIL save or suffer one level of exhaustion. While a creature suffers from this exhaustion, it loses most of its memories aside from basic information about itself, such as its name and its capabilities, and it is wracked with nightmarish visions that include a crimson rune.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.description: While in an area of dim or bright light, the crimson jelly is invisible. While in darkness, creatures without darkvision can see the jelly’s faint crimson glow.

actions.name: Feeding Paddles
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of necrotic damage. The crimson jelly gains temporary HP equal to the necrotic damage dealt, and it attaches to the target. If the jelly had advantage on this attack, it attaches to the target’s face, leaving the target unable to breathe or speak while the jelly is attached.

actions.name: – While attached, the crimson jelly can use only the Feeding Paddles action, and it moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the jelly’s movement
actions.description: The Crimson jelly can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the jelly by succeeding on a DC 12 FIT check.

bonus_actions.name: Reproduce (Requires Temporary HP)
bonus_actions.description: While the crimson jelly has 1 or more temporary HP, it can split part of itself off into a new crimson jelly with HP equal to the original crimson jelly’s temporary HP. The original crimson jelly then loses any temporary HP it has. The new crimson jelly otherwise has all the same statistics as its parent, except the new jelly can’t gain temporary HP from Feeding Paddles attacks until it finishes a long rest.

traits.description: The mycolid can pinpoint the location of each friendly mycolid within 120 feet of it. In addition, its telepathy range increases to 120 feet when communicating with other mycolids.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The mycolid is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Gardening Pick
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Slowing Spores (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The mycolid ejects slowing spores from its body. Each creature that isn’t a mycolid within 5 feet of the mycolid must make a DC 13 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 1 hit of poison damage and is slowed until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t slowed. A slowed creature’s speed is halved, and it can’t take reactions.

bonus_actions.name: Fetid Feast
bonus_actions.description: The mycolid draws sustenance from a Medium or larger pile of carrion or rotting vegetation within 5 feet of it. It regains 5 (2d4) HP. The mycolid can’t use Fetid Feast on a pile of carrion or vegetation if it or another mycolid has already used Fetid Feast on that pile.

A frightened creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Until it finishes a long rest, the worg can sense the direction but not the exact location of each creature that was frightened by Loathsome Howl.

traits.name: Echolocation
traits.description: The darkmantle can’t use its keensense while deafened.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the darkmantle remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a cave formation, such as a stalactite or stalagmite.

traits.name: Jagged Hide
traits.description: A creature that hits the darkmantle with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 hit of piercing damage.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The darkmantle is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Crush
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the darkmantle attaches to it. If the target is Medium or smaller and the darkmantle has advantage on the attack roll, the darkmantle attaches to the target’s head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the darkmantle is attached. While attached, the darkmantle can’t make Crush attacks, and at the start of each of the darkmantle’s turns, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. 	 The attached darkmantle moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the darkmantle’s movement. It can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the darkmantle by succeeding on a DC 13 FIT check.

actions.name: Topple
actions.description: While attached to a creature, the darkmantle swings its body to throw off the balance of the creature to which it is attached. The attached target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target fails the save and is already prone, it is restrained while the darkmantle is attached to it, as the darkmantle pins it to the ground.

bonus_actions.name: Darkness Aura (1/Day)
bonus_actions.description: A 15-foot radius of magical darkness extends out from the darkmantle, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The darkness lasts as long as the darkmantle maintains concentration, up to 10 minutes (as if concentrating on a spell). Darkvision can’t penetrate this darkness, and no natural light can illuminate it. If any of the darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell creating the light is dispelled.

bonus_actions.description: The deep gnome throws a magic-infused crystal at a point it can see within 30 feet of it, shattering the crystal, which emits a rapid series of discordant waves of magic. traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience

traits.name: Rust Metal
traits.description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the rust monster corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the rust monster is destroyed after dealing damage.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The rust monster can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Antennae

If the object is being worn or carried by a creature, the creature can make a DC 11 FIT save to avoid the rust monster’s touch.

actions.name: – If the object touched is either metal armor or a metal shield being worn or carried, it takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers
actions.description: Armor reduced to an AC of 10 or a shield that drops to a +0 bonus is destroyed. If the object touched is a held metal weapon, it rusts as described in the Rust Metal trait.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The ooze can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Corrode Metal
traits.description: Any nonmagical weapon made of metal that hits the ooze corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the ooze is destroyed after dealing damage. The ooze can eat through 2-inch-thick, nonmagical metal in 1 round.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the ooze remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from ordinary fresh or curing mortar.

traits.name: Ooze Nature
traits.description: The ooze doesn’t require sleep.

traits.name: Ooze Resilience
traits.description: The ooze is resistant to the grappled and restrained conditions, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The ooze can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of acid damage, and if the target is wearing nonmagical metal armor, the armor is partly corroded and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

reactions.name: Solidify
reactions.description: When the ooze is hit by an attack, it can partially solidify its body, reducing the damage it takes by 2 (1d4). If it has taken fire damage since the start of its last turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 3 (1d6) instead. The ooze can’t use this reaction if it has taken cold damage since the start of its last turn.

bonus_actions.name: Shadow Bond
bonus_actions.description: One creature the shadow can see within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 12 WIL save or the shadow bonds with the target’s shadow for 1 minute. While bonded with the target’s shadow, the shadow can use this bonus action to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of that creature, provided the creature is within 120 feet of the shadow.

bonus_actions.description: The shadow takes the Hide action. It can use this bonus action only while in dim light or darkness.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The star crow is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.description: The star crow sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

actions.name: Radiant Touch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of radiant damage, and the star crow attaches to the target. While attached, the star crow can use only the Thought Share action and Blinding Burst bonus action, and it moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the star crow’s movement. The star crow can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the star crow by succeeding on a DC 13 FIT check.

actions.name: Thought Share
actions.description: The star crow learns some of the attached target’s memories, and the attached target experiences a rapid sequence of memories from other creatures the star crow has encountered. The target takes 1 hit of psychic damage and must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be stunned until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Blinding Burst (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.description: The star crow dims then suddenly bursts with blinding light. Each creature within 30 feet of the star crow must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the weasel can steal one item the target is wearing or carrying, provided the item weighs no more than 10 pounds, isn’t a weapon, and isn’t wrapped around or firmly attached to the target. For example, a weasel could steal a hat or belt pouch but not a creature’s shirt or armor.

reactions.name: Repellent Spray

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the lemure’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage.  In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison  damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Hellish Rejuvenation
traits.description: Unlike other outsiders, a lemure that dies in its home plane of the Hells is restored in a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears in the Hells within 1 mile of where it was slain. Only sprinkling holy water on the lemure’s remains can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rippling Heat (1/Day)
bonus_actions.description: The lemure exudes an aura of extreme heat for 1 minute. Each creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the lemure and that isn’t a devil must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or be weakened until the start of its next turn. A weakened creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls, and it deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Fitness. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more suffers one level of exhaustion. A creature that has suffered a level of exhaustion from this lemure’s Rippling Heat can’t suffer another level from this lemure’s Rippling Heat for 24 hours.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Sting
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage plus 2 (1d4) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 11 CON save or be poisoned for 1 hour. If the creature fails the save by 5 or more, it falls unconscious while poisoned in this way, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

actions.name: Puff of Smoke (1/Day)
actions.description: The pseudodragon exhales a cloud of smoke in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on itself. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for 1 minute or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The crab can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 12). The crab has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

bonus_actions.name: Pincer Pinch
bonus_actions.description: One breathing creature grappled by the crab must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be unable to speak or cast spells with verbal components and begin suffocating, as the crab squeezes the air from the target’s lungs. This effect lasts until the grapple ends.

traits.name: Pack Tactics

traits.name: Abyssal Rejuvenation
traits.description: Unlike other outsiders, a dretch that dies in its home plane of the Abyss is restored in a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears in a random location in the Abyss. Only sprinkling holy water on the dretch’s remains can prevent this trait from functioning.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The dretch is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Fetid Cloud (1/Day)
bonus_actions.description: A 10-foot radius cloud of disgusting green gas extends out from the dretch, moves with it, and spreads around corners. The cloud’s area is lightly obscured and lasts 1 minute or until a strong wind disperses it. A creature that starts its turn in the cloud must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. While poisoned in this way, a creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both, and can’t take reactions.

bonus_actions.name: Poison Weapon
bonus_actions.description: The drow coats one weapon it is wearing or carrying in one of the following poisons. Each time the drow hits a creature with that weapon, the target must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute and suffer the chosen poison’s effect while poisoned in this way. The poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The poison remains on the weapon until the start of the drow’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Beetle’s Bite
bonus_actions.description: The target’s speed is halved while poisoned.

bonus_actions.name: –   Dark Caress
bonus_actions.description: The target is blinded while poisoned.

bonus_actions.name: –   Nightmare’s Kiss
bonus_actions.description: The target is frightened of the drow while poisoned.

bonus_actions.name: –   Slumber’s Call
bonus_actions.description: The target falls unconscious while poisoned or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time.

actions.description: If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Gang Up (1/Day)
actions.description: The goblin moves up to half its speed toward a creature it can see. Each friendly goblin within 30 feet of the goblin can use its reaction to join the gang up and move up to half its speed toward the same target. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions. If the initiating goblin is within 5 feet of the target, the target must make a DC 12 FIT save, taking 1 hit of bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. For each goblin after the first that participated in the gang up and that is within 10 feet of the target, the damage increases by 1 as arrows, knives, sharp pocket scraps, and similar "weapons" fly at the target from all angles. Afterwards, each goblin after the first that participated in the gang up can’t use Gang Up until it finishes a short or long rest.

bonus_actions.name: Strange Bauble
bonus_actions.description: The grimlock reaches into a pocket, pulls out a small object, and throws it at a creature the grimlock can sense within 30 feet. The grimlock chooses one of the following objects:

bonus_actions.name: –   Flashing Rock
bonus_actions.description: The grimlock throws a warm, scintillating rock at the target that bursts with a myriad of colors. The target must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Illusory Dancer
bonus_actions.description: The grimlock throws a small disk that emits a blurry, fractured illusion of a graceful, humanoid dancer. The target must succeed on a DC 11 WIL save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn as it is mesmerized by the dance.

bonus_actions.name: –   Whirling Death
bonus_actions.description: The grimlock throws a small, bladed gear that grows larger and larger as it travels toward the target, threatening to slice the target into pieces. The target must succeed on a DC 11 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. On a success, the target realizes the gear’s growth was a magical, illusory effect and that the gear never increased in size.

original.senses: keensense 30 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
traits.description: The grimlock’s Perception is 16 when perceiving by hearing or smell.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: The grimlock’s Stealth is 18 while in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Suppressed Senses
traits.description: The grimlock can’t use its keensense while deafened and unable to smell.

actions.name: Spiked Club
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 2 (1d4) piercing damage.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The sprite is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.description: The sprite can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Shortbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the poisoned target falls unconscious for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: The sprite magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the sprite wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Heart Sight
bonus_actions.description: The sprite touches a creature and magically knows the creature’s current emotional state. If the target fails a DC 13 WIL save, the sprite also knows if the creature has malign intentions or intends to commit malevolent acts within the next hour. Celestials, Fiends, and Undead automatically fail the save.

bonus_actions.name: Swift Flight
bonus_actions.description: The sprite moves up to half its speed without provoking reactions.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge can’t attack, and at the start of each of the stirge’s turns, the target loses 4 (1d4 + 2) HP due to blood loss. The attached stirge moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the stirge’s movement. If can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. It does so after it drains 8 HP of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

reactions.name: Reactive Wiggle
reactions.description: When the stirge is the target of an attack from a creature within 5 feet of it while it is attached to a creature, the stirge can wiggle, exposing the flesh where it is attached. The attacker must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or the attack targets the creature to which the stirge is attached instead of the stirge.

actions.name: Blood Drain
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the stirge can’t attack, and at the start of each of the stirge’s turns, the target loses 4 (1d4 + 2) HP due to blood loss. The attached stirge moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the stirge’s movement. If can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. It does so after it drains 8 HP of blood from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the stirge.

reactions.name: Reactive Wiggle

The attacker must succeed on a DC 12 DEX save or the attack targets the creature to which the stirge is attached instead of the stirge.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

reactions.description: When a creature the baboon can see attacks it while within 5 feet of it, the baboon can bare its teeth, puff its chest, or emit a quick series of barks. The attacker must succeed on a DC 11 WIL save or have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Home in the Wilds
traits.description: The wild warrior automatically discerns true north when outside, and checks to follow its tracks in forest, grassland, hills, or mountain terrain have disadvantage, unless the wild warrior chooses to leave obvious signs of its passage.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The wild warrior has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the warrior’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Spear
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Quick Trap
bonus_actions.description: The wild warrior cobbles together a makeshift trap with materials at hand and throws the trap at a creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or be restrained until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –    A blinded creature can’t see and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight
–    Attack rolls against a blinded creature have advantage, and a blinded creature’s attack rolls have disadvantage
–    A charmed creature can’t attack the charmer or target the charmer with harmful abilities or magical effects
–    The charmer has advantage on any ability check to interact socially with the creature
–    A deafened creature can’t hear and automatically fails any ability check that requires hearing
Some special abilities and environmental hazards, such as starvation and the long-term effects of freezing or scorching temperatures, can lead to a special condition called exhaustion
bonus_actions.description: Exhaustion is measured in six levels. An effect can give a creature one or more levels of exhaustion, as specified in the effect’s description.

bonus_actions.name: If an already exhausted creature suffers another effect that causes exhaustion, its current level of exhaustion increases by the amount specified in the effect’s description
A creature suffers the effect of its current level of exhaustion as well as all lower levels
bonus_actions.description: For example, a creature suffering two levels of exhaustion has its speed halved and has disadvantage on ability checks.

bonus_actions.name: An effect that removes exhaustion reduces its level as specified in the effect’s description
bonus_actions.description: All exhaustion effects end if a creature’s exhaustion level is reduced below one.

bonus_actions.name: Finishing a long rest reduces a creature’s exhaustion level by one, provided that the creature has also had some food and drink
–    A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight
–    The creature can’t willingly move closer to the source of its fear
–    A grappled creature’s speed becomes 0, and it can’t benefit from any bonus to its speed
–    The condition ends if the grappler is incapacitated (see the incapacitated condition)
–    The condition also ends if an effect removes the grappled creature from the reach of the grappler or grappling effect, such as when a creature is hurled away by the thunderwave spell
–    An incapacitated creature can’t take actions or reactions
–    An invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense
bonus_actions.description: A creature with the invisible condition can always attempt to hide and has advantage on FIT (Stealth) checks to do so. The creature’s location can be detected by any noise it makes or any tracks it leaves.

bonus_actions.name: –    Attack rolls against an invisible creature have disadvantage, and an invisible creature’s attack rolls have advantage
–    A paralyzed creature is incapacitated (see the incapacitated condition) and can’t move or speak
–    The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saves
–    Attack rolls against a paralyzed creature have advantage
–    Any attack that hits a paralyzed creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature
–    A petrified creature is transformed, along with any nonmagical objects it is wearing or carrying, into a solid inanimate substance (usually stone)
bonus_actions.description: Its weight increases by a factor of ten, and it ceases aging.

bonus_actions.name: –    The creature is incapacitated (see the incapacitated condition), can’t move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings
–    Attack rolls against a petrified creature have advantage
–    The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saves
–    The creature has resistance to all damage
–    The creature is immune to poison and disease, although a poison or disease already in its system is suspended, not neutralized
–    A poisoned creature has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks
–    A prone creature’s only movement options are to crawl or to stand up
bonus_actions.description: Standing up costs an amount of movement equal to half the creature’s speed and ends the condition.

bonus_actions.name: –    The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls
–    An attack roll against a prone creature has advantage if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature
bonus_actions.description: Otherwise, the attack roll has disadvantage.

bonus_actions.name: –    A restrained creature’s speed becomes 0, and it can’t benefit from any bonus to its speed
–    Attack rolls against a restrained creature have advantage, and a restrained creature’s attack rolls have disadvantage
–    The creature has disadvantage on Dexterity saves
–    A stunned creature is incapacitated (see the incapacitated condition), can’t move, and can speak only falteringly
–    The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saves
–    Attack rolls against a stunned creature have advantage
–    A surprised creature can’t move or take an action on its first turn of combat, and it can’t take a reaction until after its first turn ends
–    An unconscious creature is incapacitated (see the incapacitated condition), can’t move or speak, and is unaware of its surroundings
–    The creature drops whatever it’s holding and falls prone (see the prone condition)
–    The creature automatically fails Strength and Dexterity saves
–    Attack rolls against an unconscious creature have advantage
–    Any attack that hits an unconscious creature is a critical hit if the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The lantern hagfish is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Bioluminescent Slime
traits.description: The lantern hagfish sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The hagfish can alter the radius as a bonus action. In addition, the hagfish has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one other hagfish is within 5 feet of the creature and that other hagfish isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Void Dweller
traits.description: The lantern hagfish doesn’t require air or sleep, and it is immune to the effects of Void terrain. In addition, it can swim through the Void as if through water.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a prone creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead, the hagfish can burrow into the creature’s flesh. While burrowed into a creature, the hagfish can’t attack, and at the start of each of the hagfish’s turns, the target loses 3 (1d4 + 1) HP as the hagfish consumes it from the inside. The burrowed hagfish moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the hagfish’s movement. It can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. It does so after it consumes 6 HP worth of flesh from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can take its action to extract the burrowed hagfish by succeeding on a DC 11 WIL (Medicine) check.

bonus_actions.name: Slime Slide
bonus_actions.description: While on a solid surface, the lantern hagfish slides up to 15 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature without provoking reactions. Each space on that surface along that line is coated in slime until the start of the hagfish’s next turn. Each creature in that line, and any creature that enters a slime-coated space for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or fall prone.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The lantern hagfish is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Bioluminescent Slime
traits.description: The lantern hagfish sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The hagfish can alter the radius as a bonus action. In addition, the hagfish has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one other hagfish is within 5 feet of the creature and that other hagfish isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Void Dweller
traits.description: The lantern hagfish doesn’t require air or sleep, and it is immune to the effects of Void terrain. In addition, it can swim through the Void as if through water.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 3 (1d4 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a prone creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead, the hagfish can burrow into the creature’s flesh. While burrowed into a creature, the hagfish can’t attack, and at the start of each of the hagfish’s turns, the target loses 3 (1d4 + 1) HP as the hagfish consumes it from the inside. The burrowed hagfish moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the hagfish’s movement. It can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. It does so after it consumes 6 HP worth of flesh from the target or the target dies. A creature, including the target, can take its action to extract the burrowed hagfish by succeeding on a DC 11 WIS (Medicine) check.

bonus_actions.name: Slime Slide
bonus_actions.description: While on a solid surface, the lantern hagfish slides up to 15 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any creature without provoking opportunity attacks. Each space on that surface along that line is coated in slime until the start of the hagfish’s next turn. Each creature in that line, and any creature that enters a slime-coated space for the first time on a turn must succeed on a DC 11 DEX save or fall prone.

traits.name: Bound Construct
traits.description: The homunculus serves another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded and on the same plane of existence, the companion can sense what the homunculus senses and the two can communicate telepathically. While the homunculus is within 100 feet of the companion, it can use a reaction to deliver any spell the companion casts that has a range of touch. If the spell requires an attack roll, the homunculus uses the companion’s spell attack modifier for the roll. While the homunculus is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion has advantage on INS (Arcana) and INS (Investigation) checks.  	 At any time and for any reason, the homunculus can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The homunculus doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Construct Resilience
traits.description: The homunculus is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. If the save fails by 5 or more, the target is instead poisoned for 5 (1d10) minutes and unconscious while poisoned in this way.

traits.name: Intuition
traits.description: The wyrdling rolls two dice for initiative, taking the higher number. In addition, the wyrdling has advantage on WIL (Insight) checks.

traits.name: Read Fate
traits.description: The wyrdling can spend 1 minute communing with fate on behalf of one creature that remains within 10 feet of it for the duration. The creature must ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. At the end of the minute, the wyrdling pronounces the result of the target’s inquiry. This trait works like the divination spell, except it can’t be used to answer a specific creature’s question more than once every 3 days, regardless if the creature asks a different question.

actions.name: Psychic Burst
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16,  reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Pronounce Fate
bonus_actions.description: The wyrdling pronounces the fate, either fortune or doom (the wyrdling’s choice), of one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target rolls a d4 and adds (fortune) or subtracts (doom) the number rolled to the next attack roll or save it makes before the start of the wyrdling’s next turn.

reactions.name: Call on Fate
reactions.description: When the wyrdling is attacked by a creature it can see, it can pluck the strands of fate around the creature, imposing disadvantage on that attack roll. If the attack misses, the wyrdling or one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the attacker before the end of the wyrdling’s next turn.

actions.description: The imp magically turns invisible until it attacks or uses Change Shape, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the imp wears or carries is invisible with it.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The imp magically transforms into a Medium or smaller Beast that has a CR no higher than its own or back into its true form, which is a Fiend. Without wings, it loses its flying speed. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.description: The dragon exhales slowing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 11 FIT save. In addition, the creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Arcane Weapons
traits.description: The mage apprentice’s weapon attacks are magical. When the mage hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Reckless Show-Off
traits.description: If it can see a fellow apprentice or its magical teacher at the start of its turn, the mage apprentice has advantage on the first spell attack roll it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it also have advantage until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 14 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of force damage.

actions.name: Arcane Bolt

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The mage apprentice casts one of the following spells, using INS as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 12).

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The death dog is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.description: The death dog has two heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The death dog makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or contract a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target is poisoned. Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must repeat the save, reducing its HP maximum by 5 (2d4) on a failure. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest after the disease is cured. The creature dies if the disease reduces its HP maximum to 0.

bonus_actions.name: Dual Bark
bonus_actions.description: The death dog’s two heads bark at creatures in two 15-foot cones. Each creature in the area of a cone must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be deafened until the end of its next turn. If the cones overlap each other, each creature in overlapping cones must make only one save with disadvantage rather than one save for each cone.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: While out of water, the octopus can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage
traits.description: The octopus’s Stealth is 18 while underwater.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.description: The octopus can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Tentacles
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13), if it is a Huge or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The octopus can grapple up to two creatures at one time.

bonus_actions.name: Tentacle Slam
bonus_actions.description: The octopus slams a Medium or smaller creature it is grappling into a solid surface. The target must make a DC 13 FIT save, taking 2 hits of bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reactions.name: Ink Dash (Recharge 4-6)
reactions.description: When a creature the octopus can see deals damage to it, the octopus can release a 20-foot-radius cloud of ink all around itself, if it is underwater. The area is heavily obscured until the end of the octopus’s next turn, although a significant current can disperse the ink. Then, the octopus can swim up to its swimming speed. If it does so, it immediately releases any creatures it is grappling.

ymiat.resistances: The dryad has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The dryad is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The dryad has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: One with the Forest
traits.description: While in a forest, the dryad can’t be surprised, and it leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.description: The dryad can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Tree Stride
traits.description: Once on its turn, the dryad can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or larger.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dryad makes two Vine Whip or Blast of Pollen attacks. If both Vine Whip attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be restrained by vines until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Vine Whip
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Blast of Pollen
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Charming Scent
bonus_actions.description: The dryad emits an alluring, floral scent toward one Beast or Humanoid it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 WIL save or be charmed for 1 minute. While charmed, the target views the dryad as an ally and views the dryad’s requests favorably, though it isn’t under the dryad’s control. The charmed creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The dryad can have up to two creatures charmed in this way at a time.

bonus_actions.name: Forest’s Aid (21 HP or Fewer, 1/Day)
bonus_actions.description: The dryad magically calls a horde of squirrels, rabbits, mice, and other small animals native to the forest. The horde uses the statistics of 1 swarm of rats. The called creatures arrive on initiative count 20 of the next round, acting as allies of the dryad and obeying its spoken commands. They remain for 1 hour, until the dryad dies, or until the dryad dismisses them as a bonus action.

traits.name: Duergar Resilience
traits.description: The duergar is resistant to the charmed and paralyzed conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells and illusions.

traits.name: Reduce
traits.description: If the duergar starts its turn enlarged, it can choose to end the effect and return to its normal size (no action required).

traits.name: Heightened Sight
traits.description: The eagle’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Seabird
traits.description: The eagle can swim up to 40 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement either flying or on a solid surface, such as a ship or beach. If it is swimming at the end of its turn, it must succeed on a DC 11 FIT save or it immediately begins to sink and suffocate. A suffocating eagle must succeed on a DC 13 FIT check to fly out of the substance where it is sinking.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The eagle makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the eagle can’t use its Talons on another target.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement

traits.name: Undead Nature

traits.name: Undead Resilience

The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

reactions.description: When the specter takes damage from a creature it can see within 30 feet of it, the specter can shriek with the fury of its tormented existence. That creature must succeed on a DC 12 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The frog can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.description: The frog’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Toxic Skin
traits.description: The frog’s skin is coated in a hallucinogenic toxin. A creature that touches the frog or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a DC 13 FIT save. On a failure, a creature is poisoned until the end of its next turn and experiences mild hallucinations while poisoned.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the frog can’t Bite another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.description: The frog makes one Bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. The swallowed target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the frog, and it takes 2 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the frog’s turns. The frog can have only one target swallowed at a time.

actions.name: – If the frog takes any damage from the swallowed creature, the frog must succeed on a DC 11 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 5 feet of the frog
actions.description: If the frog dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 5 feet of movement, exiting prone.

bonus_actions.name: Reeling Tongue
bonus_actions.description: The frog lashes out its tongue at one Large or smaller creature it can see within 20 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be pulled up to 15 feet closer to the frog.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 15, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of thunder damage.

bonus_actions.name: Luring Song
bonus_actions.description: The harpy sings a magical melody. Every Humanoid and Giant within 300 feet of the harpy that can hear the song must succeed on a DC 11 WIL save or be charmed until the song ends. The harpy must use a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the harpy is incapacitated. 	 While charmed by the harpy, a target is incapacitated and ignores the songs of other harpies. If the charmed target is more than 5 feet away from the harpy, the target must move on its turn toward the harpy by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn’t avoid reactions, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the harpy, the target can repeat the save. A charmed target can also repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. If the save is successful, the effect ends on it. A target that successfully saves is immune to this harpy’s song for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The thrall can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the thrall has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 8 when perceiving by sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vampire thrall makes two Rapier attacks.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

reactions.name: Repay the Gift
reactions.description: When a friendly vampire the thrall can see within 5 feet of it is hit by an attack that would reduce the vampire to 0 HP, the thrall can give some of its life force to save the vampire. The thrall loses 10 (3d6) HP, and the vampire regains HP equal to that amount.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hippocampus can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Shared Breath
traits.description: The hippocampus’s gills pull more air from the water than the hippocampus needs, expelling the excess as bubbles down its neck and across its back. If an air-breathing creature is riding the hippocampus, these bubbles can provide that creature a supply of fresh air when the hippocampus isn’t in combat or traveling at a fast pace.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hippocampus makes one Bite attack and one Tail Slap attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail Slap
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rearing Kick
bonus_actions.description: The hippocampus rears up and kicks its forelegs at one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone or pushed up to 10 feet away from the hippocampus (the hippocampus’s choice).

traits.name: Carrion Sense
traits.description: The vulture can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
traits.description: The vulture’s Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The vulture has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vulture’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vulture makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

reactions.name: Defensive Bile
reactions.description: When a creature the vulture can see hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, the vulture can spit partially digested carrion at the creature. The attacker must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or take 1 hit of acid damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Carrion Sense
traits.description: The vulture can pinpoint, by scent, the location of carrion, dead creatures, and Undead without the Incorporeal Movement trait within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
traits.description: The vulture’s Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The vulture has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the vulture’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vulture makes one Beak attack and one Talons attack.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talons
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (2d4 + 2) slashing damage.

reactions.name: Defensive Bile
reactions.description: When a creature the vulture can see hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it, the vulture can spit partially digested carrion at the creature. The attacker must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or take 5 (2d4) acid damage and be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

ymiat.resistances: If the aboleth fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The aboleth is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the aboleth fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Probing Telepathy
traits.description: If a creature the aboleth can see communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature’s greatest desires.

traits.name: Slime Pox
traits.description: Characterized by the slimy pustules that erupt across the victim’s body, slime pox is a disease that infects creatures attacked by an aboleth or that come into contact with an aboleth’s slime. Until the disease is cured, the infected creature can breathe air and water, can’t regain HP except when underwater, and takes 2 hits of acid damage for every 1 hour it remains outside of water or without moisture applied to its skin. Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must make a DC 16 WIL save. Each time a creature fails this save, it views the infecting aboleth more and more favorably, becoming the aboleth’s doting and protective thrall after three failed saves. The successes and failures don’t need to be consecutive, but once a creature has acquired three of a kind, it no longer has to make this save, resulting in either the creature becoming a thrall of the aboleth or an autonomous (though infected) creature. Slime pox can be cured only by the heal spell or similar magic.

traits.name: Slimy Skin
traits.description: The aboleth is coated in an otherworldly mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be infected with slime pox (see the Slime Pox trait).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The aboleth makes three Tentacle or Psychic Bolt attacks. If two Tentacle attacks hit one target, the target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or contract the slime pox disease (see the Slime Pox trait).

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Psychic Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 19, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of psychic damage.

actions.name: Psychic Torrent (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The aboleth floods the minds of up to three creatures it can see within 60 feet of it with random and horrific memories from its eons-long life. Each target must make a DC 16 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 14 hits of psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn, as its mind reels from the torrent of images, thoughts, and memories. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t incapacitated.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The aboleth automatically detects every creature and trap within 60 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Swim
legendary_actions.description: The aboleth swims up to half its speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Slime Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: One creature infected with slime pox within 30 feet of the aboleth takes 3 hits of acid damage, and the aboleth regains HP equal to the damage the creature takes.

ymiat.resistances: The deva has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Angelic Resilience
traits.description: The deva is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed and frightened conditions.

traits.name: Angelic Senses
traits.description: The deva can pinpoint the location of Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of it and knows if a place or object it can sense is consecrated or desecrated.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.description: The deva’s weapon attacks are magical. When the deva hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Immortal Nature
traits.description: The deva doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The deva has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reviving Prayer
traits.description: The deva spends 10 minutes praying to its deity for the safe return of the soul of a slain creature. At the end of the prayer, the deva touches a creature that has been dead no more than 24 hours and returns the creature to life with a number of HP equal to half its HP maximum. Reviving Prayer can’t return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts. A creature restored to life in this way can’t be returned to life by this deva again for 30 days.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The deva makes three Mace attacks.

actions.name: Mace
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of radiant damage.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.description: The deva touches another creature. The target magically regains 20 (4d8 + 2) HP and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The deva magically transforms into a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Celestial. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the deva’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the deva retains its Angelic Resilience, Angelic Senses, and Immortal Nature traits and its HP, HD, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

traits.name: Divine Strikes
traits.description: The naga’s weapon attacks are magical. When the naga hits with any weapon attack, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 necrotic damage or radiant damage (included in the attack), the naga’s choice.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The naga is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The guardian naga makes three Slam or Spit Poison attacks, or it makes one Constrict attack and two Slam attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the naga’s choice), and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the naga can’t Constrict another target.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the naga’s choice).

actions.name: Spit Poison
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 19 to save, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of poison damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the naga’s choice).

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The guardian naga casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 16).

bonus_actions.name: Protector’s Step
bonus_actions.description: The naga magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space within the sacred site or temple it protects or within 30 feet of the exterior of such a site. Swirls of golden light or tendrils of inky shadow (the naga’s choice) appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

ymiat.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The golem doesn’t require air,  food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Golem Resilience
traits.description: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The golem makes three Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slow (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The golem shares the plodding perception of timeless stone with those nearby, slowing all life to a crawl. Each creature within 10 feet of the golem must make a DC 17 WIL save. On a failure, a creature can’t use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can’t make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the creature can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Rearrange Stone
bonus_actions.description: The stone golem rearranges some of the stone comprising its body, choosing one of the following arrangements. The arrangement lasts until the golem ends the effect as a bonus action, uses this bonus action again, or until it is incapacitated.

bonus_actions.name: –   Jagged Stones
bonus_actions.description: The golem turns several of the stones on its body to point outward. Its AC is reduced by 2, and each time a creature within 5 feet of the golem hits it with a melee attack, the attacker takes 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: –   Protective Slabs
bonus_actions.description: The golem slides several flat stones around its body to protect its vulnerable areas. Its speed is reduced by 10 feet, and each time it takes damage, the damage is reduced by 5 (2d4).

original.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Golden Splendor

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 FIT save, taking 20 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Weakening Breath (Recharge 6)

actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 DEX save, taking 66 (12d10) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Weakening Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: As the gold dragon wyrmling, except it is a 30-foot cone, and the save DC is 17.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INT, WIS, and CHA scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

traits.name: Boil Over
traits.description: When the red dragon hasn’t unleashed its Fire Breath, the heat builds and rolls outward from it. While the dragon’s Fire Breath is available, it emits immense heat,  and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 FIT save, taking 16 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Claw

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 17 DEX save, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.description: Whenever the behir is subjected to lighting damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The behir is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The behir makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Swallow.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of lightning damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 5 ft., one Large or smaller creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller and the behir isn’t already grappling a creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the behir can’t Constrict another target.

actions.name: Swallow
actions.description: The behir makes one Bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the behir, and it takes 6 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the behir’s turns. A behir can have only one creature swallowed at a time.

actions.name: – If the behir takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from the swallowed creature, the behir must succeed on a DC 14 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls prone in a space within 10 feet of the behir
actions.description: If the behir dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

traits.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
traits.description: The djinni’s Stealth is 21, it can hover while flying, can’t manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack, or barrel.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The djinni makes three Scimitar or Storm Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of lightning damage or thunder damage (the djinni’s choice).

actions.name: Storm Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of lightning damage plus 2 hits of thunder damage.

actions.name: Create Air Elemental (1/Day)
actions.description: The djinni magically creates one air-based Elemental of CR 5 or lower in an unoccupied space the djinni can see within 30 feet of it. The elemental acts as an ally of the djinni, obeying its spoken commands. The elemental remains for 1 hour, until the djinni dies, or until the djinni dismisses it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Travel the Planes (1/Day)
actions.description: The djinni transports itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except it can affect only itself and can’t use this action to banish an unwilling creature.

bonus_actions.name: Create Whirlwind
bonus_actions.description: The djinni creates whirlwinds of air around up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT check or be restrained by a whirlwind. A creature, including the target, can take its action to free the restrained target by succeeding on a DC 17 FIT check. 		 While at least one creature is restrained by one of these whirlwinds, the djinni can use this bonus action to move the whirlwind up to 30 feet, and the restrained target moves with it.

bonus_actions.name: Genie Shape
bonus_actions.description: The djinni magically transforms into a Medium cloud of sparkling, blue air or back into its bipedal form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its bipedal form if it dies. The djinni can’t use this bonus action to transform into its bipedal form while inside a Medium or smaller container.

bonus_actions.name: Blazing Palisade
bonus_actions.description: The efreeti magically creates a translucent wall of fire along a solid surface at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. The wall can be up to 1 foot thick, up to 45 feet long, and up to 5 feet high, and it can be any shape. Each creature in a space where the fire appears must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage. A creature that successfully saves can move to the wall’s edge, out of the fire. A creature that enters the wall for the first time on a turn or ends its turn within 5 feet of the wall must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage. The efreeti can have only one fire wall active at a time. If it creates another, the previous fire wall disappears.

bonus_actions.name: Genie Shape
bonus_actions.description: The efreeti magically transforms into a Medium cloud of thick smoke filled with sparks of fire or back into its bipedal form. Its statistics are the same in each form.
