traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. WIL (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity  have disadvantage.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The sphinx is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Psychic Claws
traits.description: The sphinx’s Claw attacks are magical. When the sphinx hits with a Claw attack, the Claw deals an extra 3d6 psychic damage (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The sphinx makes three Claw attacks, or it makes four Psychic Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of psychic damage.

actions.name: Psychic Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of psychic damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

bonus_actions.name: Psychic Connection
bonus_actions.description: One creature the sphinx can see within 60 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be mentally connected to the sphinx until the sphinx chooses to end it or until the sphinx dies or the target dies. While connected in this way, the sphinx can cause the target to experience one of the following effects at the start of each of the target’s turns. The effect lasts until the start of the target’s next turn or until the connection ends. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the connection on a success.

bonus_actions.name: –   Disoriented
bonus_actions.description: When the target moves, it moves in a random direction.

bonus_actions.name: –   Distracted
bonus_actions.description: When the target casts a spell, it must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be unable to cast the spell, using the action, bonus action, or reaction to cast the spell but not expending the spell slot or similar limited use of the spell.

bonus_actions.name: –   Seeing Double
bonus_actions.description: The target has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Psychic Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx sends out a burst of psychic energy. Each creature within 20 feet of the sphinx that has an INS of 8 or higher must succeed on a DC 17 INS save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn, as it reels from the psychic onslaught.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack

traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Fork attacks and one Tail attack, or it makes three Hurl Flame attacks.

actions.name: Fork
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d8 + 6) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +10 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (3d10 + 6) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than a Construct or Undead, it must succeed on a DC 17 CON save or lose 10 (3d6) HP at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 10 (3d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 WIS (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (5d6 + 3) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

bonus_actions.name: Headbutt
bonus_actions.description: The horned devil slams its horned head into a creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must make a DC 17 STR save. On a failure, the target takes 7 (2d6) bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 hits of fire damage.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The remorhaz is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.description: The remorhaz can burrow through ice, snow, and permafrost, and it leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be swallowed by the remorhaz. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 3 hits of acid damage and 3 hits of fire damage at the start of each of the remorhaz’s turns.

actions.name: – If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a swallowed creature, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 19 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz
actions.description: If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

bonus_actions.name: Vent Heat (119 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: As the remorhaz’s life force ebbs, its body generates more heat to protect itself. It can open valves in its carapace to vent this excess heat. Each creature within 5 feet of the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or suffer one level of exhaustion.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the remorhaz or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The remorhaz is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.description: The remorhaz can burrow through ice, snow, and permafrost, and it leaves a 5-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 40 (6d10 + 7) piercing damage plus 10 (3d6) fire damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 DEX save or be swallowed by the remorhaz. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the remorhaz, and it takes 10 (3d6) acid damage and 10 (3d6) fire damage at the start of each of the remorhaz’s turns.

actions.name: – If the remorhaz takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a swallowed creature, the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 19 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the remorhaz
actions.description: If the remorhaz dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

bonus_actions.name: Vent Heat (119 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: As the remorhaz’s life force ebbs, its body generates more heat to protect itself. It can open valves in its carapace to vent this excess heat. Each creature within 5 feet of the remorhaz must succeed on a DC 17 CON save or suffer one level of exhaustion.

traits.name: Heightened Sight
traits.description: The roc’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The roc is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Seabird
traits.description: The roc can swim up to 60 feet on its turn, but it must start and end its movement either flying or on a solid surface, such as a ship or beach. If it is swimming at the end of its turn, it must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or it immediately begins to sink and suffocate. A suffocating roc must succeed on a DC 19 FIT check to fly out of the substance where it is sinking.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The roc makes one Beak attack and two Talon attacks. If both Talon attacks hit one Huge or Gargantuan creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can’t use its Talons on another target.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Talon
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 17) if it is a Large or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the roc can’t use its Talons on another target.

bonus_actions.name: Territorial Shriek
bonus_actions.description: The roc shrieks a territorial challenge at up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. While frightened by this shriek, a creature must take the Dash action on its turn and move away from the roc by the safest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

traits.name: Heightened Sight
traits.description: The roc’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The roc is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (4d8 + 9) piercing damage.

actions.name: Talon

While frightened by this shriek, a creature must take the Dash action on its turn and move away from the roc by the safest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The sila can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Fluid Body (Bipedal Form Only)
traits.description: The sila can move through the space of any creature, regardless of size, and a creature of any size can move through a sila’s space. In addition, the sila can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Nebulous (Cloud Form Only)
traits.description: The sila’s Stealth is 21, it can hover while flying, can’t manipulate objects or attack, and it can pass through any space air or water can pass through without squeezing. In addition, it can enter and hide in any Tiny or larger container, such as a pouch, lamp, backpack,  or barrel.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The sila makes four Cold-Infused Jambiya or Water Burst attacks. If two Water Burst attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the sila.

actions.name: Cold-Infused Jambiya
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Water Burst
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Create Water Elemental (1/Day)
actions.description: The sila magically creates one water-based Elemental of CR 5 or lower in an unoccupied space the sila can see within 30 feet of it. The elemental acts as an ally of the sila, obeying its spoken commands. The elemental remains for 1 hour, until the sila dies, or until the sila dismisses it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Travel the Planes (1/Day)
actions.description: The sila transports itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except it can affect only itself and can’t use this action to banish an unwilling creature.

bonus_actions.name: Clouded Eyes
bonus_actions.description: The sila condenses the air or water around the head or eyes of up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Genie Shape
bonus_actions.description: The sila magically transforms into a Medium cloud of thick mist that leaves droplets of water on everything it touches or back into its bipedal form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its bipedal form if it dies. The sila can’t use this bonus action to transform into its bipedal form while inside a Medium or smaller container.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The sila can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Fluid Body (Bipedal Form Only)
traits.description: The sila can move through the space of any creature, regardless of size, and a creature of any size can move through a sila’s space. In addition, the sila can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage plus 5 (2d4) cold damage.

actions.name: Water Burst
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (4d6 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

actions.description: The sila magically creates one water-based Elemental of CR 5 or lower in an unoccupied space the sila can see within 30 feet of it. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its bipedal form if it dies. The sila can’t use this bonus action to transform into its bipedal form while inside a Medium or smaller container.

ymiat.languages: Common, Druidic, plus any one language

traits.name: Nature’s Champion
traits.description: While the archdruid is conscious, wearing no armor, and in a natural environment or terrain, such as a desert, forest, or mountain, it adds its WIL modifier to its AC (included above). In addition, it is resistant to cold, fire, lightning, poison, and thunder damage.

traits.name: Nature’s Weapons
traits.description: When the archdruid hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (included in the attack), the archdruid’s choice.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The archdruid makes three Thorned Staff or Nature’s Wrath attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Thorned Staff
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5. ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of piercing damage plus 5 hits of cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (the archdruid’s choice).

actions.name: Nature’s Wrath
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: + 9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 8 hits of cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (the archdruid’s choice).

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The archdruid casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The archdruid magically transforms into a Beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the archdruid retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL modifiers, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

bonus_actions.name: – The archdruid can choose to instead magically transform into an Elemental that has a challenge rating no higher than 6, or back into its true form
bonus_actions.description: If it transforms into an Elemental, the archdruid can remain in that form for up to 6 hours then must finish a short or long rest before it can transform into an Elemental again.

actions.name: Nature’s Wrath
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: + 9 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 27 (5d8 + 5) cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage (the archdruid’s choice).

actions.name: Spellcasting

ymiat.resistances: The archmage has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The archmage has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Ward
traits.description: While the archmage is conscious, wearing no armor, and not inside of an antimagic effect, it adds its INS modifier to its AC (included above). In addition, it is resistant to force damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The archmage makes three Arcane Blast attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Arcane Blast
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 8 hits of force damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the archmage and knocked prone.

actions.name: Burst of Magic (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The archmage releases a burst of swirling, multicolored, magical energy on a point it can see within 60 feet of it. Each creature within 20 feet of that point must make a DC 17 FIT save, taking 10 hits of force damage and 5 hits of acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage (the archmage’s choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The archmage casts one of the following spells, using INS as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

bonus_actions.name: Shimmering Step
bonus_actions.description: The archmage teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Sparks of arcane energy appear at the origin and destination when it uses this bonus action.

reactions.name: Counter Spell
reactions.description: When a creature the archmage can see within 30 feet of it casts a spell, the archmage can counter the spell, interrupting the casting. This reaction works like the counterspell spell with a +5 spellcasting ability check, except the archmage must always make the ability check, regardless of the spell’s circle. The archmage has advantage on this check if the spell is on the Arcane source spell list.

traits.name: Disciplined Fighter

traits.name: –   Aggressive
traits.description: The erinyes has advantage on the first attack it makes on its turn, but the next attack roll against the erinyes has advantage.

traits.name: –   Retributive
traits.description: The next time the erinyes is hit by a melee weapon attack from a creature within 5 feet of it, the erinyes can make one Longsword attack against the attacker (no action required).

traits.name: –   Defensive
traits.description: The next time erinyes uses the Parry reaction, it takes only half the damage if the attack hits and regains 18 (4d8) HP if the attack doesn’t hit.

traits.name: Poisonous Weapons
traits.description: The erinyes’s weapon attacks are magical. When the erinyes hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 poison damage (included in the attack).

actions.description: The erinyes makes three Longsword or Longbow attacks.

actions.name: Longbow

reactions.description: The erinyes adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the erinyes must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

ymiat.resistances: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.immunities: blinded, deafened, charmed, frightened, paralyzed | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: Common plus up to two other languages

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.description: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The lich doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The lich is immune to poison damage,  to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Versatile Artist
traits.description: At the end of each long rest, the lich chooses one form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. Until it finishes a long rest, the lich has immunity to one type of damage, which is associated with its artistic expression. For example, a lich expressing art through song or poetry has immunity to thunder damage, a lich expressing art through fashion has immunity to slashing damage, and a lich expressing art through paint has immunity to acid damage. This trait can’t give the lich immunity to force, psychic, or radiant damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The virtuoso lich uses Corrupted Art. It then makes three Artistic Flourish attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Artistic Flourish
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of damage of the type chosen with the Versatile Artist trait plus 3 hits of force damage.

actions.name: Call Muse
actions.description: The lich chooses one Beast or Humanoid it can  see within 30 feet of it to be its muse. The target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or become the lich’s muse and be charmed by the lich for 1 minute. While charmed, the muse has a speed of 0 and is incapacitated as it watches or listens to the lich’s artistic expression. The muse can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lich’s Call Muse for the next 24 hours. If the muse suffers harm from the lich, it is no longer charmed.  	 The lich can have only one muse at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous muse ends. If the lich is within 30 feet of its muse and can see its muse, the lich has advantage on its first Artistic Flourish attack each round against a creature that isn’t its muse.

actions.name: Corrupted Art
actions.description: The lich hums a discordant melody, paints a crumbling symbol of death in the air, performs a reality-bending pirouette, or emulates some other expression of corrupted or twisted art and targets one creature it can see, other than itself, within 60 feet. This action’s effects change, depending on if the target is Undead.

actions.name: –   Non-Undead
actions.description: The target must make a DC 17 WIL save. On a failure, a creature is blinded, charmed, or deafened (the lich’s choice) until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: –   Undead
actions.description: The target regains 18 (4d8) HP. Healing that exceeds the target’s HP maximum becomes temporary HP.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The lich casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

legendary_actions.name: Call Muse
legendary_actions.description: The lich uses Call Muse.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.description: The lich moves up to its speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The lich uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Unrestrained Art (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The lich unleashes the full force of its artistic talents. Each creature with 15 feet of the lich must make a DC 17 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 3 hits of damage of the type chosen with the Versatile Artist trait and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

original.resistances: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
original.immunities: blinded, deafened, charmed, frightened, paralyzed | Undead Resilience
original.languages: Common plus up to two other languages

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.description: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The lich doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The lich is immune to poison damage,  to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Versatile Artist
traits.description: At the end of each long rest, the lich chooses one form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. Until it finishes a long rest, the lich has immunity to one type of damage, which is associated with its artistic expression. For example, a lich expressing art through song or poetry has immunity to thunder damage, a lich expressing art through fashion has immunity to slashing damage, and a lich expressing art through paint has immunity to acid damage. This trait can’t give the lich immunity to force, psychic, or radiant damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The virtuoso lich uses Corrupted Art. It then makes three Artistic Flourish attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Artistic Flourish
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) damage of the type chosen with the Versatile Artist trait plus 9 (2d8) force damage.

actions.name: Call Muse
actions.description: The lich chooses one Beast or Humanoid it can  see within 30 feet of it to be its muse. The target must succeed on a DC 17 WIS save or become the lich’s muse and be charmed by the lich for 1 minute. While charmed, the muse has a speed of 0 and is incapacitated as it watches or listens to the lich’s artistic expression. The muse can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the lich’s Call Muse for the next 24 hours. If the muse suffers harm from the lich, it is no longer charmed.  	 The lich can have only one muse at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous muse ends. If the lich is within 30 feet of its muse and can see its muse, the lich has advantage on its first Artistic Flourish attack each round against a creature that isn’t its muse.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Suffocating Heat
traits.description: As the young brass dragon, except it affects creatures within 20 feet of the dragon, and the save DC is 18.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Sleep Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 FIT save, taking 13 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sleep Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales sleep gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or fall unconscious for 5 minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 16 WIL save or be vulnerable to fire damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to fire damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to fire damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

ymiat.resistances: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The nalfeshnee is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Horrific Nimbus
traits.description: The nalfeshnee magically emits scintillating, multicolored light that disorients and frightens mortals. Each creature that isn’t an Aberration, Celestial, or Fiend and that starts its turn within 15 feet of the nalfeshnee must succeed on a DC 16 WIL save or be frightened until the start of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more must take the Dash action on its turn and move away from the nalfeshnee by the safest available route, unless there is nowhere to move.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The nalfeshnee has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The nalfeshnee makes one Bite attack, one Gore attack, and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If this attack hits a frightened creature, the nalfeshnee regains HP equal to half the damage dealt.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Gore
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Teleport
bonus_actions.description: The nalfeshnee magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Sudden Feast
reactions.description: When a creature the nalfeshnee can see within 20 feet of it is reduced to 0 HP or dies, the nalfeshnee can move up to its speed toward the creature without provoking reactions then feast on the creature, if it moves to within 5 feet of the creature. The nalfeshnee regains HP equal to twice the creature’s CR or class level, and the creature has disadvantage on the next death save it makes, if it is making death saves.

ymiat.immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | prone

traits.name: Limited Magic Immunity
traits.description: The rakshasa can’t be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saves against all other spells and magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The rakshasa makes four Claw or Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting. If two Claw attacks hit one creature, the target is cursed. While cursed, the target gains no benefit from finishing a short or long rest. The curse lasts until removed by the remove curse spell or similar magic.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of force damage.

actions.name: Arcane Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 21, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of force damage.

actions.name: Travel the Planes (1/Day)
actions.description: The rakshasa magically transports itself to a different plane of existence. This works like the plane shift spell, except the rakshasa can affect only itself and can’t use this action to banish an unwilling creature.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The rakshasa casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18).

bonus_actions.name: Charming Gaze
bonus_actions.description: The rakshasa turns its gaze toward one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. If the target can see the rakshasa, the target must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be charmed for 1 minute. A charmed creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The rakshasa can have up to three creatures charmed in this way at a time.

bonus_actions.name: Illusory Appearance
bonus_actions.description: The rakshasa covers itself and anything it is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes it look like another creature of its general size and Humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the rakshasa takes a bonus action to end it or if the rakshasa dies. 	 The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, a creature touching the disguised rakshasa might feel its fur instead of Humanoid flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 25 INS (Investigation) check to discern that the rakshasa is disguised.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Influence Weather
traits.description: Nearby weather responds to the storm giant’s desires. At the start of each minute, the storm giant can choose to change the precipitation, temperature, and wind within 3 miles of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the control weather spell, except the conditions change immediately and the storm giant can’t change the temperature by more than one stage up or down from the area’s standard temperature.

traits.name: Stormsight
traits.description: The storm giant can see through areas obscured by clouds, fog, rain, snow, and storms without penalty.

traits.name: Updraft
traits.description: While in an area open to the sky,  the storm giant has a flying speed of 30 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes three Greatsword attacks, or it makes four Lightning Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of lightning damage. If the giant scores a critical hit, the target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Thunderous Strike (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 11 hits of lightning damage and 6 hits of thunder damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

reactions.name: Stormy Rebuke
reactions.description: When a creature the storm giant can see hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the giant, the giant can send a stormy blast at the creature. The attacker must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the giant and knocked prone.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The giant can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Influence Weather
traits.description: Nearby weather responds to the storm giant’s desires. At the start of each minute, the storm giant can choose to change the precipitation, temperature, and wind within 3 miles of it by one stage, up or down (no action required). This effect works like the changing weather conditions aspect of the control weather spell, except the conditions change immediately and the storm giant can’t change the temperature by more than one stage up or down from the area’s standard temperature.

traits.name: Stormsight
traits.description: The storm giant can see through areas obscured by clouds, fog, rain, snow, and storms without penalty.

traits.name: Updraft
traits.description: While in an area open to the sky,  the storm giant has a flying speed of 30 feet.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes three Greatsword attacks, or it makes four Lightning Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 30 (6d6 + 9) slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d8 + 4) lightning damage. If the giant scores a critical hit, the target must succeed on a DC 17 CON save or be paralyzed until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Thunderous Strike (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The giant hurls a magical lightning bolt at a point it can see within 500 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 17 DEX save. On a failure, a creature takes 36 (8d8) lightning damage and 21 (6d6) thunder damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

reactions.name: Stormy Rebuke
reactions.description: When a creature the storm giant can see hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the giant, the giant can send a stormy blast at the creature. The attacker must succeed on a DC 17 STR save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the giant and knocked prone.

ymiat.speed: 30 ft., climb 30 ft., fly 30 ft., swim 20 ft.
ymiat.resistances: If the vampire fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Hungry Dead Nature
traits.description: The vampire doesn’t require air or sleep. In addition, it must consume at least 80 ounces of blood (approximately half the blood in a Medium Humanoid’s body) every 24 hours, or it loses its immunity to exhaustion and risks starvation until it does so. While it has any levels of exhaustion from starvation, the vampire can’t remove levels of exhaustion until it consumes at least 160 ounces of blood.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the vampire fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Misty Escape
traits.description: When it drops to 0 HP outside its resting place, the vampire transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Mist Form bonus action) instead of falling unconscious, provided it isn’t in sunlight or running water. If it can’t transform, it is destroyed. While it has 0 HP in mist form, it can’t revert to its vampire form, and it must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in its resting place, it reverts to its vampire form. It is then paralyzed until it regains at least 1 HP. After spending 1 hour in its resting place with 0 HP, it regains 1 HP.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The vampire regains 20 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

traits.name: Resting Place
traits.description: The vampire has a coffin, grave, sarcophagus, or similar location just large enough for it to lie down designated as its resting place. While in its resting place, the vampire doesn’t suffer exhaustion levels from starvation and has keensense out to a range of 120 feet.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.description: The vampire has the following flaws:

traits.name: Forbiddance
traits.description: The vampire can’t enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.

traits.name: Harmed by Running Water
traits.description: The vampire takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

traits.name: Stake to the Heart
traits.description: If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into the vampire’s heart while the vampire is incapacitated in its resting place, the vampire is paralyzed until the stake is removed.

traits.name: Sunlight Hypersensitivity
traits.description: The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

traits.name: Vampiric Resilience
traits.description: The vampire is immune to exhaustion.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vampire can use Charm. It then makes three Bite or Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a Draining Bite attack. If two Claw attacks hit one Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 17).

actions.name: Bite (Bat, Rat, or Wolf Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Claw (Vampire Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Draining Bite (Bat or Vampire Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage. The target’s HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains HP equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0. A Humanoid slain in this way and then fed at least one drop of the vampire’s blood rises the following night as a vampire spawn under the vampire’s control.

actions.name: Charm (Vampire Form Only)
actions.description: One Humanoid the vampire can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be magically charmed for 1 day, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire takes a bonus action to end the effect. The charmed target obeys the vampire’s verbal commands and is a willing target for the vampire’s Draining Bite attack. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. 	 The vampire can have up to two creatures charmed in this way at a time. If it charms a third, the effect on the first target ends.

actions.name: Children of the Night
actions.description: The vampire magically calls 2d4 swarms of bats or rats, provided that the sun isn’t up. While outdoors, the vampire can call 3d6 wolves instead. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the vampire and obeying its spoken commands. The Beasts remain for 1 hour, until the vampire dies, or until the vampire dismisses them as a bonus action. The vampire can have any number of such Beasts under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Beasts is no higher than 4.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The vampire transforms into a Tiny bat, Tiny rat, Medium wolf, or back into its true form, which is Undead. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing transforms with it, but anything it is carrying doesn’t transform with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Mist Form
bonus_actions.description: The vampire transforms into a Medium cloud of mist or back into its true form, which is Undead. While in mist form, it can’t take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. It is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and it can’t pass through water. It has advantage on FIT, FIT, and FIT saves, and it is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.description: The vampire moves up to its speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Call Children (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The vampire uses Children of the Night.

legendary_actions.name: Excessive Bleeding (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: Each creature within 15 feet of the vampire that doesn’t have all its HP must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or lose 14 (4d6) HP as its wounds bleed profusely. Before the end of its next turn, the vampire has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against a creature that failed this save.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Acidic Vapors
traits.description: After the black dragon uses its Acid Breath, acid clings to its mouth, throat, and nostrils for a time, evaporating as the dragon breathes. While the dragon’s Acid Breath is unavailable, acidic vapors surround it, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of acid damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 16 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 18 FIT save, taking 15 hits of acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 16 WIL save or be vulnerable to acid damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to acid damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to acid damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Snow Walk
traits.description: The devil can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Tail attack, or it makes three Icicle Shard attacks.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Icicle Shard
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of piercing damage plus 5 hits of cold damage.

bonus_actions.name: Ice Wall
bonus_actions.description: The ice devil causes a wall of ice to magically rise from the ground at a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The wall is up to 30 feet long, 10 feet high, and 5 feet thick. It can be any shape, as long as its base is connected to the ground. If the wall cuts through a creature’s space when it appears, the creature is pushed to one side (the devil’s choice). If a creature would be surrounded on all sides by the wall, it can make a DC 17 FIT save. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.  	 The wall lasts 1 minute, until the devil creates a new wall, or until the devil dies. Each 10-foot section of the wall has AC 5, 30 HP, is vulnerable to fire damage, and is immune to acid, cold, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage.

reactions.name: Ice Shield
reactions.description: When the ice devil or a friendly creature it can see is hit by an attack, the devil can create a magical barrier of ice to disrupt the attack. The target halves the damage from the attack.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Lightning Extraction
traits.description: As the young bronze dragon, except it affects creatures within 20 feet of the dragon, and the save DC is 19.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Repulsion Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 FIT save, taking 18 hits of lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Repulsion Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or be pushed up to 30 feet away from the dragon.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be vulnerable to lightning damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to lightning damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to lightning damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 20 FIT save or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

traits.name: Hallucinogenic Gas
traits.description: After the green dragon exhales its Poison Breath, wisps of poisonous gas laced with the alchemical taint that permeates the dragon’s body linger around it. ymiat.languages: any languages the animating spirit knew in life

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The living colossus doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Construct Resilience
traits.description: The living colossus is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the living colossus remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal statue or monument of the individual it represents.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.description: The living colossus is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The living colossus deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The living colossus makes three Slam attacks, or it makes four Spirit Blast attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 27 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Spirit Blast
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 22, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of psychic damage.

actions.name: Thunderous Clap (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The living colossus slams its hands together, creating a thunderous wave in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 FIT save, taking 17 hits of thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Quake
bonus_actions.description: The living colossus strikes the ground with its foot. Each creature within 30 feet of the living colossus must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or be knocked prone and have the air knocked from its lungs, if it is a breathing creature, until the start of the living colossus’s next turn. A creature with the air knocked from its lungs can’t speak or cast spells with verbal components. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also stunned until the start of the living colossus’s next turn.

reactions.name: Bolstering Spirit
reactions.description: When a friendly creature the living colossus can see within 60 feet of it, other than itself, takes damage, the living colossus can share some of the life force of the spirit animating it with that friendly creature. The target gains 14 (4d6) temporary HP for 1 minute. If the target would take enough damage to reduce it to 0 HP, it instead regains 14 (4d8) HP.

ymiat.resistances: If the mummy lord fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.immunities: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | charmed, frightened, paralyzed | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the mummy lord fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The mummy lord has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: A destroyed mummy lord gains a new body in 24 hours if its heart is intact, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the mummy lord’s heart.

traits.name: Turning Defiance
traits.description: The mummy lord and any friendly Undead within 30 feet of it have advantage on saves against effects that turn undead.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The mummy lord doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The mummy lord is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mummy makes two Blessed Khopesh attacks and one Rotting Fist attack, or it makes four Divine Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Blessed Khopesh
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach  5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the mummy  lord’s choice).

actions.name: Rotting Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be cursed with mummy rot (see the Mummy Rot sidebar).

actions.name: Divine Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 20, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the mummy lord’s choice).

actions.name: Undead Servitors
actions.description: The mummy lord magically calls 2d6 skeletons or zombies, 1d4 specters, or 2 mummies. The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the mummy lord and obeying its spoken commands. The Undead remain for 1 hour, until the mummy lord dies, or until the mummy lord dismisses them as a bonus action. The mummy lord can have any number of Undead under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Undead is no higher than 6.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The mummy lord casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

bonus_actions.name: Bolster Undead
bonus_actions.description: The mummy lord sends necrotic power into up to three friendly Undead it can see, other than itself, within 30 feet of it. Each target regains 14 (4d6) HP and has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the mummy lord’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Dreadful Glare
bonus_actions.description: The mummy lord glares at up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration.

legendary_actions.name: Detect Life
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord automatically detects every creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Sandy Teleport
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord transforms into loose sand and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, reforming in that space. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it.

legendary_actions.name: Call Servitors (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord uses Undead Servitors.

legendary_actions.name: Unleash Divine Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord unleashes a wave of divine energy. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 17 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of necrotic damage or radiant damage (the mummy lord’s choice) and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

original.resistances: If the mummy lord fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
original.immunities: necrotic; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | charmed, frightened, paralyzed | Undead Resilience
original.languages: the languages it knew in life

The called creatures arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the mummy lord and obeying its spoken commands. The Undead remain for 1 hour, until the mummy lord dies, or until the mummy lord dismisses them as a bonus action. The mummy lord can have any number of Undead under its control at one time, provided the combined total CR of the Undead is no higher than 6.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The mummy lord casts one of the following spells, using WIS as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 17).

bonus_actions.name: Bolster Undead
bonus_actions.description: The mummy lord sends necrotic power into up to three friendly Undead it can see, other than itself, within 30 feet of it. Each target regains 14 (4d6) HP and has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the mummy lord’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Dreadful Glare
bonus_actions.description: The mummy lord glares at up to two creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 WIS save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed for the same duration.

legendary_actions.name: Detect Life
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord automatically detects every creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Sandy Teleport
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord transforms into loose sand and teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see, reforming in that space. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it.

legendary_actions.name: Call Servitors (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord uses Undead Servitors.

legendary_actions.name: Unleash Divine Energy (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The mummy lord unleashes a wave of divine energy. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 17 CON save. On a failure, a creature takes 14 (4d6) necrotic damage or radiant damage (the mummy lord’s choice) and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The purple worm is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Tunneler
traits.description: The purple worm can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed, and it leaves a 10-foot-diameter tunnel in its wake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The worm makes one Bite attack and one  Tail Stinger attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or be swallowed by the purple worm. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside of the worm, and it takes 6 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the worm’s turns.  	 If the worm takes 30 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the worm must succeed on a DC 21 FIT save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the worm. If the worm dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse by using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tail Stinger
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 19 FIT save, taking 12 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Thrash (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The purple worm convulses its large body, smashing everything around it. Each creature within 20 feet of the worm must make a DC 19 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 16 hits of bludgeoning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

bonus_actions.name: Rapid Digestion
bonus_actions.description: The purple worm’s digestive system absorbs some of the already digested material from creatures it has swallowed. If the purple worm has at least one swallowed creature inside it, the purple worm regains 9 (2d8) HP. This healing increases by 4 (1d8) for each creature currently inside the purple worm, to a maximum of 10d8.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Charged Hide
traits.description: When the blue dragon hasn’t exhaled its Lightning Breath, the electric charge builds up across its body. While the dragon’s Lightning Breath is available, it emits wild sparks of electricity, and each creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or be incapacitated until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of lightning damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales lightning in a 90-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 19 FIT save, taking 20 hits of lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or be vulnerable to lightning damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to lightning damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to lightning damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 20 FIT save or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

ymiat.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Golem Resilience
traits.description: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Fire Absorption
traits.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the fire damage dealt.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Warrior Stance
traits.description: At the start of each of its turns, the iron golem chooses one of the following fighting stances to adopt, which lasts until the start of the golem’s next turn.

traits.name: –   Aggressive
traits.description: When the golem uses Multiattack, it can replace one additional Spear Arm attack with a Shield Bash attack. If it does so, its AC is reduced by 2 until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: –   Retributive
traits.description: The next time the golem is hit by a melee weapon attack from a creature within 5 feet of it before the start of its next turn, the golem can slam its shoulder into the attacker as a reaction. The attacker must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the golem and knocked prone.

traits.name: –   Defensive
traits.description: The golem’s AC increases by 4, but it can’t make Shield Bash attacks until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The golem makes four Spear Arm attacks. It can replace one Spear Arm attack with a Shield Bash attack.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Spear Arm
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Expel Poisonous Gas (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The golem vents poisonous gas from small holes across its body. Each creature within 15 feet of the golem must make a DC 18 FIT save, taking 16 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

original.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Reactive
traits.description: The marilith gets up to five extra reactions, but these extra reactions can be used only for Parry.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The marilith makes two Dagger attacks, two Mace attacks, and two Longsword attacks. It can replace two Dagger attacks with a Tail attack.

bonus_actions.name: Marilith Tactics
bonus_actions.description: The marilith shouts one of the following commands at up to two friendly creatures it can see within  30 feet of it:

bonus_actions.name: –   March! Each target can use a reaction to move up to half its speed in a direction of the marilith’s choice
bonus_actions.description: This movement is unaffected by difficult terrain and doesn’t provoke reactions.

bonus_actions.name: –   Protect Yourself! Each target gains the marilith’s Parry reaction until the start of the marilith’s next turn
–   Remember Your Training! Each target has advantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the start of  the marilith’s next turn
Teleport
bonus_actions.description: The marilith magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The marilith adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reactions.description: The marilith adds 5 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the marilith must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

ymiat.resistances: The planetar has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The planetar makes two Greatsword attacks, or it makes three Radiant Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting. If two Greatsword or Radiant Bolt attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 22, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 9 hits of radiant damage.

actions.name: Radiant Burst (Recharge 6)
actions.description: A pulse of divine power ripples out from the planetar’s golden halo. Each hostile creature within 15 feet of the planetar must make a DC 19 FIT save, taking 16 hits of radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each friendly creature within 15 feet of the planetar is empowered with divine energy and has advantage on all melee attack rolls it makes before the start of the planetar’s next turn.

actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
actions.description: The planetar touches another creature. The target magically regains 30 (6d8 + 3) HP and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The planetar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 19).

original.resistances: The planetar has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Radiant Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +11 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (6d8 + 6) radiant damage.
