ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Golden Splendor
traits.description: As the young gold dragon, except it affects creatures within 20 feet of the dragon, and the save DC is 21.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Weakening Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 FIT save, taking 22 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Weakening Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: As the gold dragon wyrmling, except it is a 60-foot cone, and the save DC is 21.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature  and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be vulnerable to fire damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to fire damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to fire damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 FIT save or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.description: The sphinx is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell that it refuses. WIL (Insight) checks made to ascertain the sphinx’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

traits.name: Magical Claws
traits.description: The sphinx’s Claw attacks are magical. When the sphinx hits with a Claw attack, the Claw deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The sphinx is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The sphinx makes four Claw or Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of force damage.

actions.name: Arcane Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 23, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of force damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The sphinx casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 18).

bonus_actions.name: Roar
bonus_actions.description: The sphinx emits one of the following magical roars. Each roar is audible up to 300 feet away. When it roars, the sphinx chooses up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it to be affected by the roar. A creature that fails a save and is affected by an ongoing effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: –   Rumbling Roar
bonus_actions.description: This deep roar rumbles through each target’s body, rattling it to its bones. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or deal only half damage with weapon attacks that use FIT or FIT for 1 minute.

bonus_actions.name: –   Terrifying Roar
bonus_actions.description: This shrill roar tugs at the self-preservation instincts within creatures. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. While frightened, a creature’s speed is 0. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also paralyzed while frightened.

bonus_actions.name: –   Thunderous Roar
bonus_actions.description: This booming roar slams against the chosen creatures. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the sphinx, knocked prone, and deafened for 1 minute.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Lacerating Swipe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The sphinx rears up on its hind legs, wings fluttering, and swipes in a wide arc with both its forepaws. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a DC 18 FIT save or take 3 hits of slashing damage and suffer a bleeding wound. A creature with a bleeding wound loses 5 (1d10) HP at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 18 WIL (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the bleeding creature receives magical healing.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon turtle can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The dragon turtle deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon turtle makes one Bite attack, two Claw attacks, and one Tail attack. If it is latched onto a vehicle, it can instead make four Claw attacks and one Tail attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage. Instead of dealing damage, the dragon turtle can choose to latch onto the target, if the target is a vehicle, such as a ship or wagon. If the vehicle is Huge or smaller, its speed is reduced to 0, and it can’t be moved until the dragon turtle is killed or ends this effect. If the vehicle is Gargantuan, the vehicle’s speed is halved, and the turtle moves with it when it moves. While latched onto a vehicle in this way, the turtle can make Bite attacks against only the vehicle and such attacks automatically hit. The turtle can end this effect at any time (no action required).

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 24 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 FIT save, taking 16 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn’t grant resistance against this damage.

reactions.name: Siege Follow-Through
reactions.description: If the dragon turtle destroys an object or structure with an attack, it can make a Bite or Tail attack against a creature it can see within 5 feet of that object or structure.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 33 (4d12 + 7) piercing damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 20 (3d8 + 7) slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 19 STR save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the dragon turtle and knocked prone.

actions.name: Steam Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon turtle exhales scalding steam in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 CON save, taking 56 (16d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Being underwater doesn’t grant resistance against this damage.

reactions.name: Siege Follow-Through
reactions.description: If the dragon turtle destroys an object or structure with an attack, it can make a Bite or Tail attack against a creature it can see within 5 feet of that object or structure.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Corrosive Scales
traits.description: As the young copper dragon.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Slowing Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 27 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 120-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 21 FIT save, taking 23 hits of acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Slowing Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: As the copper dragon wyrmling, except it is a 90-foot cone, and the save DC is 21.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be vulnerable to acid damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to acid damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to acid damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 FIT save or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

actions.description: The dragon exhales poisonous gas in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 21 CON save, taking 84 (24d6) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 CHA save or be vulnerable to poison damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to poison damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to poison damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 22 DEX save or take 22 (4d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The balor is resistant to cold and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Diving Assault

If the target is prone, the balor can make one Longsword attack against it as a bonus action.

bonus_actions.description: The balor magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of acid damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the ankheg can’t Bite another target.

actions.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The ankheg spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide, provided it has no creature grappled. Each creature in that line must make a DC 13 FIT save, taking 5 hits of acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus_actions.name: Save for Later
bonus_actions.description: The ankheg quickly digs a small hole and stuffs one creature grappled by it into the hole, burying the creature and ending the grapple. A buried creature is restrained and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature, including the buried creature, can take its action to free the buried creature by succeeding on a DC 13 FIT check.

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Ooze Cube
traits.description: The cube takes up its entire space. Other creatures can enter the space, but are subjected to the cube’s Engulf and have disadvantage on the save. Creatures inside the cube can be seen but have total cover. 	 A creature within 5 feet of the cube can take an action to pull a creature or object out of the cube. Doing so requires a successful DC 12 FIT check, and the creature making the attempt takes 3 hits of acid damage. 	 The cube can hold only one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures inside it at a time.

traits.name: Ooze Nature
traits.description: The cube doesn’t require sleep.

traits.name: Ooze Resilience
traits.description: The cube is resistant to the grappled and restrained conditions, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

traits.name: Transparent
traits.description: While motionless, the cube’s Stealth is 15, even when the cube is in plain sight.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of acid damage.

actions.name: Engulf
actions.description: The cube moves up to its speed. While doing so, it can enter a Large or smaller creature’s space. When the cube enters a creature’s space, the creature must make a DC 13 FIT save. On a success, the creature can choose to be pushed 5 feet back or to the side of the cube. A creature that chooses not to be pushed suffers the consequences of a failed save. On a failed save, the cube enters the creature’s space, the creature takes 3 hits of acid damage, and is engulfed. The engulfed creature can’t breathe, is restrained, and takes 6 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the cube’s turns. When the cube moves, the engulfed creature moves with it. 	 An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 13 FIT check. On a success, the creature escapes and enters a space of its choice within 5 feet of the cube.

reactions.name: Skewer Prey
reactions.description: When the gelatinous cube is subjected to piercing damage, it can move a random creature engulfed by it to intercept the attack. The creature takes the piercing damage as if it were the target.

traits.name: Aberrant Ground
traits.description: The ground within 10 feet of the mouther is dough-like difficult terrain. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The mouther is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Gibbering
traits.description: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn’t incapacitated. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and that can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn and must roll a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and moves its full speed in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

bonus_actions.description: The mouther spits an otherworldly goo at up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Aberrant Ground
traits.description: The ground within 10 feet of the mouther is dough-like difficult terrain. A creature that starts its turn in the area must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or its speed is halved until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The mouther is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Gibbering
traits.description: The mouther babbles incoherently while it can see any creature and isn’t incapacitated. A creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the mouther and that can hear the gibbering must succeed on a DC 13 WIS save or it can’t take reactions until the start of its next turn and must roll a d8 to determine what it does during its turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action or bonus action and moves its full speed in a randomly determined direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach or does nothing if it can’t make such an attack.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The gibbering mouther makes two Bite attacks. If both attacks hit one Medium or smaller creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Rend Mind
actions.description: One creature the mouther can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 WIS save or take 18 (4d8) psychic damage and suffer a random, short-term dread effect for 1 minute

bonus_actions.name: Blinding Spittle
bonus_actions.description: The mouther spits an otherworldly goo at up to two creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 13 DEX save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Antimagic Susceptibility
traits.description: The rug is incapacitated while in the area of an antimagic field. If targeted by dispel magic, the rug must succeed on a FIT save against the caster’s spell save DC or fall unconscious for 1 minute.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The rug doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Construct Resilience
traits.description: The rug is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.description: While it is grappling a creature, the rug takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and the creature grappled by the rug takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the rug remains motionless and isn’t flying, it is indistinguishable from a normal rug.

actions.name: Smother
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one Medium or smaller creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 13). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, blinded, and unable to breathe, and the rug can’t fly and can’t Smother another target.

actions.name: Squeeze Prey
actions.description: The rug of smothering tightens around a creature it is grappling. The target must make a DC 13 FIT save, taking 5 hits of bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A breathing creature that fails this save by 5 or more has the remaining air squeezed from its lungs and begins suffocating.

bonus_actions.name: Rolling Charge (25 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: If it isn’t grappling a creature, the rug curls up and rolls along the ground up to triple its speed straight toward a creature it can sense. If it stops within 5 feet of the target, it can make one Smother attack against the target.

traits.name: Opportunist

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The bandit captain makes one Dagger attack and two Scimitar attacks, or it makes three Dagger attacks.

actions.name: Dagger
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Reposition Forces (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.description: Each friendly bandit and thug under the bandit captain’s command moves up to half its speed in a direction of the captain’s choice. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions.

bonus_actions.name: Steal Item
bonus_actions.description: The bandit captain steals an object from one creature it can see within 5 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or lose one object it is wearing or carrying of the bandit captain’s choice. The object must weigh no more than 10 pounds, can’t be a weapon, and can’t be wrapped around or firmly attached to the target, such as a shirt or armor.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The bandit captain adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the captain must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The sea hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The sea hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Horrific Appearance
traits.description: When a Humanoid that can see the hag’s true form starts its turn within 30 feet of the hag, the hag can force it to make a DC 12 WIL save. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: – Unless surprised or the revelation of the hag’s true form is sudden, such as the ending of Illusory Appearance, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn
traits.description: If the creature does so, it can’t see the hag until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the hag in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: Underwater Camouflage
traits.description: The hag’s Stealth is 18 while underwater and not using Illusory Appearance.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hag uses Death Glare. It then makes two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Death Glare
actions.description: One creature the hag can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 12 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. If the target is already frightened and fails the save, it is reduced to 0 HP instead. If reduced to 0 HP in this way, the creature is stable.

bonus_actions.name: Illusory Appearance
bonus_actions.description: The hag covers itself and anything it is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes it look like another creature of its general size and Humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if the hag dies. 	 The changes from this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching it would feel its scaly flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 INS (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

reactions.name: Barnacle Block
reactions.description: When the hag takes damage from a source it can see, the hag can shift the barnacles and scales on its body to absorb some of the impact, reducing the damage by 4 (1d8).

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The lizardfolk shaman casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13).

bonus_actions.name: Poisoned Body (32 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: The shaman coats itself in poison until the start of its next turn. It takes 1 hit of poison damage. In addition, the next time a creature hits the shaman with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the shaman before the start of the shaman’s next turn, the attacker takes 2 hits of poison damage.

traits.name: Heightened Smell and Taste
traits.description: The lizardfolk’s Perception is 20 when perceiving by smell or taste.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: The lizardfolk shaman can hold its breath for 15 minutes.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The lizardfolk makes one Bite attack and one Ritual Staff attack, or it makes two Swamp Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

actions.name: Ritual Staff
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d8 + 2) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Swamp Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The lizardfolk shaman casts one of the following spells, using WIS as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13).

bonus_actions.name: Poisoned Body (32 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: The shaman coats itself in poison until the start of its next turn. It takes 3 (1d6) poison damage. In addition, the next time a creature hits the shaman with a melee attack while within 5 feet of the shaman before the start of the shaman’s next turn, the attacker takes 7 (2d6) poison damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The snake makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack, or it makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can’t Constrict another target.

bonus_actions.name: Crush
bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the snake must succeed on a DC 14 FIT or take 3 hits of bludgeoning damage and begin suffocating. The creature continues suffocating until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The snake makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack, or it makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the snake can’t Constrict another target.

bonus_actions.name: Crush
bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the snake must succeed on a DC 14 STR or take 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage and begin suffocating. The creature continues suffocating until the grapple ends.

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Heightened Hearing
traits.description: The bloatblossom’s Perception is 16 while perceiving by hearing.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The bloatblossom is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The bloatblossom makes one Bite attack and one Slam attack, or it makes two Toxic Nodule attacks. If the Bite and Slam attacks both hit one Humanoid, the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be infected with apocalyptic fungus (see sidebar).

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of poison damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13).

actions.name: Toxic Nodule
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Instinct to Pursue
bonus_actions.description: The bloatblossom takes the Dash action toward an uninfected Humanoid it can see or sense.

original.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Heightened Hearing

traits.name: Plant Resilience

actions.name: Slam

actions.name: Toxic Nodule
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.description: The bloatblossom takes the Dash action toward an uninfected Humanoid it can see or sense.

traits.name: Tools of the Trade
traits.description: The mechanist is proficient with tinker tools and doubles its proficiency bonus for any ability check it makes with tinker tools.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mechanist makes two Warhammer or Light Crossbow attacks.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save or 17 to save if used with two hands, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 14 to save, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Repair (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: The mechanist touches one friendly Construct it can see. The target regains 5 (2d4) HP.

bonus_actions.name: Quick Creation (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The mechanist cobbles together various machine parts it is carrying and creates a Tiny Construct. The Construct obeys the mechanist’s spoken commands. It uses the statistics of a solodron but it isn’t a mechadron or part of the Plan. The mechanist can have up to two such Constructs under its control at one time. Each Construct remains for 1 minute, until the mechanist dies, or until the mechanist uses this bonus action again to dismiss one or both of them.

reactions.name: Magnetic Pulse
reactions.description: When a creature the mechanist can see attacks it with a weapon made at least partially of metal while within 5 feet of it, the mechanist can release a magical, magnetic pulse. The attacker must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Tools of the Trade
traits.description: The mechanist is proficient with tinker tools and doubles its proficiency bonus for any ability check it makes with tinker tools.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mechanist makes two Warhammer or Light Crossbow attacks.

actions.name: Warhammer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) bludgeoning damage if used with two hands.

actions.name: Light Crossbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

actions.name: Repair (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: The mechanist touches one friendly Construct it can see. The target regains 5 (2d4) HP.

reactions.description: When a creature the mechanist can see attacks it with a weapon made at least partially of metal while within 5 feet of it, the mechanist can release a magical, magnetic pulse. The attacker must succeed on a DC 13 DEX save or have disadvantage on the attack roll.

traits.name: Poisonous Swarm
traits.description: The hissing, spitting, and constant nipping of snakes in the swarm leaves the swarm’s space dripping with poison. A creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can’t regain HP or gain temporary HP.

traits.name: Swarm Resilience
traits.description: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

actions.name: Bites
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, or 1 hit of piercing damage if the swarm has half of its HP or fewer. The target must make a DC 14 FIT save, taking 5 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Poisonous Swarm
traits.description: The hissing, spitting, and constant nipping of snakes in the swarm leaves the swarm’s space dripping with poison. A creature that starts its turn in the swarm’s space must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.description: The swarm can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny snake. The swarm can’t regain HP or gain temporary HP.

traits.name: Swarm Resilience
traits.description: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

actions.name: Bites
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 10 (4d4) piercing damage, or 5 (2d4) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its HP or fewer. The target must make a DC 14 CON save, taking 18 (4d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Charge
traits.description: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 hits of slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.description: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant boar makes two Tusk attacks. If both attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tusk
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Challenging Snort
bonus_actions.description: The boar snorts and stomps its feet at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn and have disadvantage on the next save it makes against being knocked prone by the boar.

traits.name: Charge
traits.description: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 (2d6) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.description: If the boar takes 10 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant boar makes two Tusk attacks. If both attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 STR save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Tusk
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Challenging Snort
bonus_actions.description: The boar snorts and stomps its feet at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIS save or be frightened until the end of its next turn and have disadvantage on the next save it makes against being knocked prone by the boar.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The merrow can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The merrow is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The merrow makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace one Claw attack with a Harpoon attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Harpoon
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the harpoon sticks in the target. While the harpoon is stuck, the merrow can’t make Harpoon attacks against other targets, and the target and merrow can’t move farther than 60 feet away from each other. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the harpoon by succeeding on a DC 14 FIT check. Alternatively, the cord connecting the merrow to the harpoon can be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; HP 15; immune to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), dislodging the harpoon into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the target and preventing the merrow from using Recall Harpoon.

bonus_actions.name: Shoving Rush
bonus_actions.description: The merrow takes the Dash action. If it moves, it can propel itself into one creature it can see along its path. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions from a target that fails this save.

bonus_actions.name: Recall Harpoon
bonus_actions.description: The merrow pulls on the cord connected to its harpoon, returning the harpoon to its empty hand. If the harpoon is stuck in a creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be pulled up to 20 feet toward the merrow. Regardless, the harpoon is dislodged and returned to the merrow’s hand.

traits.name: Heightened Smell
traits.description: The tiger’s Perception is 18 when perceiving by smell.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.description: If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claws attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the tiger can make one Claws attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.description: The tiger makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or suffer a puncture wound. A creature suffering a puncture wound loses 5 (1d10) HP at the start of each of its turns as the wound bleeds excessively. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 12 WIL (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.description: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.description: The dragon exhales lightning in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 FIT save, taking 5 hits of lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Repulsion Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be pushed up to 5 feet away from the dragon.

traits.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
traits.description: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also grappled by it (escape DC 13). Ability checks made to escape this grapple have disadvantage.

traits.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
traits.description: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

traits.name: Grappler
traits.description: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature grappled by it.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The mimic is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mimic makes two Pseudopod attacks. If it is grappling a creature, it can replace one attack with a Bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one grappled creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of acid damage.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form, the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The mimic transforms into a Large or smaller object or back into its true, amorphous form, which is a Monstrosity. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

reactions.description: When a creature the mimic can see hits it with an attack while it is grappling a creature, the mimic can roll the grappled creature in front of the blow, forcing the grappled creature to take the damage instead.

traits.description: If the centaur moves at least 30 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Pike attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the centaur can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The centaur makes one Hooves attack and one Pike attack, or it makes three Longbow attacks.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Longbow

reactions.name: Defensive Kick
reactions.description: When a creature the centaur can see within 5 feet of it hits it with an attack, the centaur can kick the attacker. The attacker must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone or pushed up to 5 feet away from the centaur (the centaur’s choice).

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the minotaur skeleton remains motionless and prone, it is indistinguishable from an inanimate minotaur skeleton.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Memories
traits.description: The minotaur skeleton has advantage on checks and saves to avoid becoming lost or to recall a path it has previously traveled.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The skeleton doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

ymiat.speed: 30 ft., burrow 15 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.description: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.description: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 FIT save, taking 7 hits of cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Dark Devotion
traits.description: The fanatic is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

traits.name: Unholy Weapons
traits.description: The fanatic’s weapons are coated in dark, magical flames. When the fanatic hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2d6 fire damage or necrotic damage (included in the attack), the fanatic’s choice.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The fanatic makes two Sacrificial Dagger or Unholy Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Sacrificial Dagger
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage or necrotic damage (the fanatic’s choice). If the target is paralyzed, prone, stunned, or unconscious, it takes an extra 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Unholy Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of fire damage or necrotic damage (the fanatic’s choice).

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The fanatic casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 13).

bonus_actions.name: Unholy Brand (Recharge 5-6)
bonus_actions.description: One creature the fanatic can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be marked with an unholy brand until the start of the fanatic’s next turn. While the creature is branded, Fiends and cultists have advantage on attack rolls against it.

ymiat.immunities: lightning, slashing | grappled, poisoned | Ooze Resilience

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The ochre jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Ooze Nature
traits.description: The ochre jelly doesn’t require sleep.

traits.name: Ooze Resilience
traits.description: The ochre jelly is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

traits.name: Overwhelming Stench
traits.description: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the ochre jelly must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it must spend its turn retching uncontrollably and be unable to move or act.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The ochre jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of acid damage. If the target is poisoned, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or also take 1 hit of poison damage.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.description: When an ochre jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new ochre jellies if it has at least 10 HP. Each new jelly has HP equal to half the original jelly’s, rounded down. New jellies are one size smaller than the original jelly.

ymiat.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.description: The will-o’-wisp can’t wear or carry anything. In addition, it adds its WIL modifier to its AC (included above).

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The will-o’-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 2 hits of force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.description: The will-o’-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o’-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The will-o’-wisp doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The will-o’-wisp is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The will-o’-wisp makes two Shock attacks.

actions.name: Shock
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: The will-o’-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Beckon, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

bonus_actions.name: Beckon
bonus_actions.description: The will-o’-wisp pulses its lightly gently toward one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or use its reaction to move up to its speed toward the will-o’-wisp by the most direct route. It doesn’t avoid reactions or damaging terrain when moving.

reactions.name: Consume Life
reactions.description: When a creature the will-o’-wisp can see within 15 feet of it is reduced to 0 HP, the will-o’-wisp can consume some of that creature’s fading life. The will-o’-wisp gains 7 (2d6) temporary HP, and the creature has disadvantage on the next death save it makes before the end of the wisp’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The druid magically transforms into a Medium or smaller Beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the druid retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL modifiers, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

traits.name: Undead Fortitude
traits.description: If damage reduces the zombie to 0 HP, it must make a FIT save with a DC equal to 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the zombie drops to 1 HP instead.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The zombie doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The zombie is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ogre zombie makes two Greatclub attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lumbering Charge (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The ogre zombie shoulders its weapon and charges forward, shoving into creatures on its way. It moves up to 20 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature’s space during this move, that creature must make a DC 14 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

bonus_actions.description: The elk bugles its might at its opponents, bolstering its confidence. It has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The ogre is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ogre makes two Greatclub or Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Greatclub
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Bowling Sweep (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The ogre sweeps its weapon in a wide arc around it. Each creature within 10 feet of the ogre must make a DC 14 FIT save. Small and smaller creatures have disadvantage on the save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of bludgeoning damage, is pushed up to 10 feet away from the ogre, and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t pushed or knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Shoving Rush
bonus_actions.description: The ogre takes the Dash action. If it moves, it can propel itself into one creature it can see along its path. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions from a target that fails this save.

ymiat.immunities: lightning | grappled, paralyzed, prone, restrained, unconscious | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ephemeral
traits.description: The will-o�-wisp can’t wear or carry anything. In addition, it adds its WIL modifier to its AC (included above).

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The will-o�-wisp can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 2 hits of force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Variable Illumination
traits.description: The will-o�-wisp sheds bright light in a 5- to 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional number of feet equal to the chosen radius. The will-o�-wisp can alter the radius as a bonus action.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The will-o�-wisp doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The will-o�-wisp is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The will-o�-wisp makes two Shock attacks.

actions.name: Shock
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 2 hits of lightning damage.

actions.name: Invisibility
actions.description: The will-o�-wisp and its light magically become invisible until it attacks or uses its Beckon, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell).

bonus_actions.name: Beckon
bonus_actions.description: The will-o�-wisp pulses its lightly gently toward one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or use its reaction to move up to its speed toward the will-o�-wisp by the most direct route. It doesn’t avoid reactions or damaging terrain when moving.

reactions.name: Consume Life
reactions.description: When a creature the will-o�-wisp can see within 15 feet of it is reduced to 0 HP, the will-o�-wisp can consume some of that creature’s fading life. The will-o�-wisp gains 7 (2d6) temporary HP, and the creature has disadvantage on the next death save it makes before the end of the wisp’s next turn.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The ettercap is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The ettercap can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.description: While in contact with a web, the ettercap knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.description: The ettercap ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ettercap makes one Bite attack and one Claws attack, or it makes two Spit Poison attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Spit Poison
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Web (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The ettercap launches a gob of webbing at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be restrained. A creature, including the restrained target, can take its action to free the target from the webbing by succeeding on a DC 13 FIT check. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; HP 5; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

ymiat.resistances: The pegasus has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
ymiat.languages: understands Celestial, Common, Elvish, and Sylvan but can’t speak

traits.name: Celestial Resilience
traits.description: The pegasus is resistant to radiant damage.

traits.name: Diving Pounce
traits.description: If the pegasus is flying and moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Hooves attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the pegasus can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The pegasus has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The pegasus’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The pegasus makes two Hooves attacks.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

reactions.name: Catch Rider
reactions.description: If the pegasus’s rider fails a check or save to remain in the saddle or is subjected to an effect that would dismount it, the pegasus can shift to catch the falling rider, preventing the rider from being dismounted.

ymiat.resistances: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Acidic Vapors
traits.description: After the black dragon uses its Acid Breath, acid clings to its mouth, throat, and nostrils for a time, evaporating as the dragon breathes. While the dragon’s Acid Breath is unavailable, acidic vapors surround it, and each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 21 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the dragon fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 27 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of acid damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the dragon’s choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 90-foot line that is 10 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 21 FIT save, taking 20 hits of acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 18 WIL save or be vulnerable to acid damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to acid damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to acid damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 23 FIT save or take 4 hits of bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking reactions.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Cold Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales an icy blast in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 23 CON save, taking 99 (22d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Paralyzing Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: As the silver dragon wyrmling, except it is a 90-foot cone, and the save DC is 23.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its Legendary Resistance trait and its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INT, WIS, and CHA scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The dragon automatically detects every creature  and trap within 30 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The dragon makes a Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Elemental Roar (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon roars at up to two creatures of its choice within 120 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 19 CHA save or be vulnerable to cold damage until the end of its next turn. A target resistant to cold damage isn’t resistant to it for the duration. A target immune to cold damage is still immune to it, even if the target fails the save.

legendary_actions.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 24 DEX save or take 17 (2d6 + 10) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

ymiat.resistances: The pit fiend has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Aura of the Devil Lord
traits.description: Each hostile creature that starts its turn within 20 feet of the pit fiend must succeed on a DC 21 WIL save or be frightened until the start of its next turn. Each friendly devil within 20 feet of the pit fiend is immune to the charmed and frightened conditions and has advantage on the first attack roll it makes on each of its turns.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Flaming Weapons
traits.description: The pit fiend’s weapon attacks are magical. When the fiend hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d6 fire damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The pit fiend has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The pit fiend makes one Bite attack, one Gore attack, one Mace attack, and one Tail attack, or it makes four Hurl Flame attacks. If two Hurl Flame attacks hit one creature, each creature within 10 feet of the target must make a DC 21 FIT save as the fire bursts outward from the target, taking 4 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage and 4 hits of poison damage. The target must succeed on a DC 21 FIT save or be poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target can’t regain HP. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Gore
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Mace
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 25 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 26 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 21 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 21, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 7 hits of fire damage.

actions.name: Mace

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 24 (3d10 + 8) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 21 STR save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +10 to hit, range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 25 (6d6 + 4) fire damage.

traits.description: When the red dragon hasn’t unleashed its Fire Breath, the heat builds and rolls outward from it. While the dragon’s Fire Breath is available, it emits immense heat, and each creature that starts its turn within 30 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 24 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage. ymiat.resistances: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.immunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | charmed, frightened, paralyzed | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: Common plus up to five other languages

traits.name: Arcane Mastery
traits.description: The lich can concentrate on two spells simultaneously. If it casts a third spell that requires concentration, the lich loses concentration on the oldest spell. If the lich is concentrating on two spells and loses concentration because of taking damage, it loses concentration only on the oldest spell.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed lich gains a new body in 1d10 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

traits.name: Turn Resistance
traits.description: The lich has advantage on saves against any effect that turns undead.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The lich doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The lich is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The lich uses Lich’s Gaze. It then makes four Arcane Death Burst attacks, or it makes three Arcane Death Burst attacks and one Death-Infused Rod attack. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Arcane Death Burst
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 23, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 hits of force damage plus 5 hits of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Death-Infused Rod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 20 FIT save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Lich’s Gaze
actions.description: The lich fixes its gaze on one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 20 WIL save or be charmed or frightened (the lich’s choice) until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The lich casts one of the following spells, using INS as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 20).

bonus_actions.name: Levitate
bonus_actions.description: The lich can rise or descend vertically up to 20 feet and can remain suspended there. This bonus action works like the levitate spell, except there is no duration, and the lich doesn’t need to concentrate to continue levitating each round.

reactions.name: Absorb Spell
reactions.description: When a creature the lich can see within 60 feet of it casts a spell, the lich can absorb the spell’s energy, countering it. This works like the counterspell spell, except the lich must always make a spellcasting ability check, no matter the spell’s circle. Its ability check for this is +12. If it successfully counters the spell, the lich gains 5 temporary HP for each level of the spell.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.description: The lich moves up to its speed without provoking reactions. If the lich is levitating, it can use this legendary action to move horizontally, propelling itself with a blast of arcane power.

legendary_actions.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The lich uses Spellcasting.

legendary_actions.name: Disrupt Life (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: Each creature within 20 feet of the lich that isn’t Undead must make a DC 20 FIT save, taking 6 hits of necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lich regains HP equal to the single highest amount of necrotic damage dealt.

original.resistances: If the lich fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

original.languages: Common plus up to five other languages
