actions.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
actions.description: The solar touches another creature. The target magically regains 40 (8d8 + 4) HP and is freed from any curse, disease, poison, blindness, or deafness.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The solar casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 22).

bonus_actions.name: Celestial Tactics
bonus_actions.description: The solar uses one of the following tactics:

bonus_actions.name: –   Empower Strikes
bonus_actions.description: The solar sends divine power into the weapons of up to two friendly creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target has advantage on the next weapon attack roll it makes before the start of the solar’s next turn. If that attack hits, the weapon deals an extra 2 hits of radiant damage.

bonus_actions.name: –   Inspire Resolve
bonus_actions.description: One friendly creature the solar can see within 30 feet of it gains 14 (4d6) temporary HP and becomes immune to the charmed and frightened conditions until the start of the solar’s next turn, ending any effect currently causing the target to be charmed or frightened.

bonus_actions.name: –   Manipulate Battlefield
bonus_actions.description: The solar commands up to three friendly creatures it can see to reposition themselves on the battlefield. Each target can use a reaction to move up to half its speed in a direction of the solar’s choice. This movement is unaffected by difficult terrain and doesn’t provoke reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Teleport
legendary_actions.description: The solar magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

legendary_actions.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The solar emits divine energy. Each creature of its choice within 10 feet of it must make a DC 22 FIT saving throw, taking 4 hits of fire damage and 4 hits of radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary_actions.name: Intimidating Glare (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The solar glares at up to three creatures it can see within 30 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 22 WIL save or be cowed until the end of its next turn. While cowed, a creature’s speed is halved, and it can’t look at the solar.

original.resistances: If the solar fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Angelic Resilience
traits.description: The solar is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed and frightened conditions.

traits.name: Angelic Senses
traits.description: The solar can pinpoint the location of Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead within 30 feet of it and knows if a place or object it can sense is consecrated or desecrated.

traits.name: Angelic Weapons
traits.description: The solar’s weapon attacks are magical. When the solar hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 6d8 radiant damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Divine Awareness
traits.description: The solar knows if it hears a lie.

traits.name: Divine Protection
traits.description: Aberrations, Celestials, Fiends, and Undead have disadvantage on attack rolls against the solar.

traits.name: Immortal Nature
traits.description: The solar doesn’t require food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the solar fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The solar has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The solar makes three Greatsword or Holy Fire Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting. If two Greatsword or Holy Fire Bolt attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 22 CON save or be blinded until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +15 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 22 (4d6 + 8) slashing damage plus 27 (6d8) radiant damage.

actions.name: Holy Fire Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +14 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 34 (6d8 + 7) radiant damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage.

ymiat.resistances: If the kraken fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.immunities: lightning; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | frightened, paralyzed
ymiat.languages: understands Abyssal, Celestial, Infernal, and Primordial but can’t speak, telepathy 120 ft.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The kraken can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Freedom of Movement
traits.description: The kraken ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can’t reduce its speed or cause it to be restrained. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being grappled.

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the kraken fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The kraken is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The kraken deals double damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The kraken makes three Tentacle attacks. It can replace one Tentacle attack with a Bite attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 28 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature grappled by the kraken, that creature is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the kraken, and it takes 12 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the kraken’s turns.

actions.name: – If the kraken takes 50 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the kraken must succeed on a DC 24 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the kraken
actions.description: If the kraken dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 15 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 28 to save, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 22). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained. The kraken has ten tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Ink Cloud (Recharge 6)
actions.description: While underwater, the kraken expels an ink cloud in a 30-foot-radius centered on the kraken. The cloud spreads around corners, and the area is heavily obscured. Each creature in the area when it first appears must make a DC 22 FIT save, taking 33 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that enters the ink cloud for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 22 FIT save or take 3 hits of poison damage and be poisoned until the start of its next turn. The cloud lasts for 1 minute or until dispersed by a strong current.

bonus_actions.name: Fling
bonus_actions.description: One Large or smaller object held or creature grappled by the kraken is thrown up to 60 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 22 FIT save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Reel
bonus_actions.description: The kraken pulls up to two creatures grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

legendary_actions.name: Swim
legendary_actions.description: The kraken swims up to half its swimming speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Tentacle Attack
legendary_actions.description: The kraken makes one Tentacle attack.

legendary_actions.name: Lightning Storm (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The kraken magically calls bolts of lightning to strike up to two creatures it can see or sense within 120 feet of it. Each creature must make a DC 22 FIT save, taking 7 hits of lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

original.resistances: If the kraken fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The mordovermis is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Sinuous Form
traits.description: The mordovermis can easily move through any opening large enough for a Small creature. It can squeeze through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The mordovermis’s destination must still have suitable room to accommodate its volume.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the mordovermis has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 9 when perceiving by sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mordovermis makes two Sting attacks. If both Sting attacks hit one Large or smaller creature, the mordovermis can use Consume on the creature without the need for the target to be incapacitated.

actions.name: Sting
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Consume
actions.description: The mordovermis wraps its body around an incapacitated creature. The target must make a DC 13 FIT save. On a failure, the target takes 1 hit of piercing damage and 3 hits of acid damage and is grappled (escape DC 13). On a success, the target takes half the damage and isn’t grappled. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 5 hits of acid damage at the start of each of its turns, and the mordovermis can’t use Consume.

bonus_actions.name: Transfixing Gaze
bonus_actions.description: The mordovermis focuses its gaze on one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be charmed until the end of its next turn. While charmed, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The basilisk is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.description: When a creature that can see the basilisk’s eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the basilisk, the basilisk can force it to make a DC 12 FIT save if the basilisk isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature magically begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.		 Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can’t see the basilisk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the basilisk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: – If the basilisk sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the basilisk mistakes itself for a rival and is affected by its own gaze

actions.description: The basilisk makes two Bite or Poison Spit attacks. If both Bite or Poison Spit attacks hit one creature, the target is poisoned until the end of its next turn.

ymiat.resistances: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Show Mettle
traits.description: While it can see a superior devil, such as a barbed devil, pit fiend, or similar, the bearded devil has advantage on saves against being charmed and frightened.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Beard Spines attacks and one Glaive attack.

actions.name: Beard Spines
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned in this way, the target can’t regain HP. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Glaive
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage. If the target is a creature other than a Construct or Undead, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or lose 3 (1d6) HP at the start of each of its turns due to an infernal wound. Each time the devil hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 3 (1d6). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 10 WIL (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing, provided the target is capable of regaining HP.

actions.name: Enhance Pain
actions.description: The bearded devil enhances the pain in one creature it can see within 30 feet of it that is poisoned from the devil’s Beard Spines attack or suffering an infernal wound from the devil’s Glaive attack. The target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn, as it doubles over in pain.

traits.name: Fungal Toxicity
traits.description: A creature that hits the mycolid with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned for 5 hours. If the poison isn’t neutralized before 5 hours have passed, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save, taking 3 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Mycolid Connection
traits.description: The spore lord can pinpoint the location of each friendly mycolid within 1 mile of it. In addition, its telepathy range increases to 1 mile when communicating with other mycolids.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The mycolid is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The spore lord makes two Fungal Staff attacks or uses Hurl Sap twice.

actions.name: Fungal Staff
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Hurl Sap
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 15 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of poison damage, and the sap sticks to the target. While the sap is stuck, the target takes 1 hit of poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use an action to scrape away the sap, ending the effect.

actions.name: Mushroom Ring (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The spore lord causes fungal growth to erupt from a point on the ground it can sense within 120 feet of it. A ring of mushrooms sprouts in a 15-foot radius around that point. Each creature that isn’t a mycolid within that ring must make a DC 14 FIT save, taking 4 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each mycolid within that ring gains 5 (2d4) temporary HP.

actions.name: Slumber Spores (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The spore lord ejects sleep-inducing spores from its body. Each creature that isn’t a mycolid within 10 feet of the spore lord must make a DC 14 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 3 hits of poison damage and falls unconscious for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn’t fall unconscious. The unconscious creature wakes if it takes damage or if a creature uses an action to wake it.

bonus_actions.name: Fetid Feast
bonus_actions.description: The spore lord draws sustenance from a Medium or larger pile of carrion or rotting vegetation within 5 feet of it. It regains 7 (2d6) HP. The spore lord can’t use Fetid Feast on a pile of carrion or vegetation if it or another mycolid has already used Fetid Feast on that pile.

original.senses: keensense 120 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)
original.languages: understands Druidic and Sylvan but can’t speak, telepathy 60 ft.

traits.name: Fungal Toxicity
traits.description: A creature that hits the mycolid with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must succeed on a DC 13 CON save or be poisoned for 5 hours. If the poison isn’t neutralized before 5 hours have passed, the creature must succeed on a DC 14 CON save, taking 9 (2d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Mycolid Connection
traits.description: The spore lord can pinpoint the location of each friendly mycolid within 1 mile of it. In addition, its telepathy range increases to 1 mile when communicating with other mycolids.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The mycolid is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The spore lord makes two Fungal Staff attacks or uses Hurl Sap twice.

actions.name: Fungal Staff
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) poison damage.

actions.name: Hurl Sap
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d8 + 2) poison damage, and the sap sticks to the target. While the sap is stuck, the target takes 4 (1d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A creature can use an action to scrape away the sap, ending the effect.

actions.name: Mushroom Ring (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The spore lord causes fungal growth to erupt from a point on the ground it can sense within 120 feet of it. A ring of mushrooms sprouts in a 15-foot radius around that point. Each creature that isn’t a mycolid within that ring must make a DC 14 CON save, taking 13 (3d8) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Each mycolid within that ring gains 5 (2d4) temporary HP.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.description: The nightmare sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

traits.name: Riding Flames
traits.description: Any creature riding a willing nightmare is resistant to fire damage. A creature riding the nightmare without the nightmare’s permission takes 1 hit of fire damage at the start of each of the nightmare’s turns.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The nightmare makes two Flaming Hoof attacks.

actions.name: Flaming Hoof
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Ethereal Stride
actions.description: The nightmare and up to three willing creatures within 5 feet of it magically enter the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

bonus_actions.name: Burning Hoofprints
bonus_actions.description: The nightmare increases the intensity of the heat on its hooves. Until the start of its next turn, it leaves burning hoofprints in any surface through which it walks, creating a trail of fire in its wake. A creature that enters a space with burning hoofprints for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or take 1 hit of fire damage. The hoofprints stop burning at the start of the nightmare’s next turn.

traits.name: Convincing Mimicry (Humanoid Form Only)
traits.description: The doppelganger can mimic any Humanoid’s body and voice it has seen and heard nearly perfectly. A creature very familiar with the individual Humanoid the doppelganger is pretending to be can tell the doppelganger is an imitation with a successful DC 20 WIL (Insight) check.

traits.name: Revealed Intentions
traits.description: While reading a creature’s mind, the doppelganger has advantage on WIL checks against the creature, knows the creature’s current mood, and knows if the creature speaks a lie. In addition, the doppelganger has advantage on attack rolls against the creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The doppelganger makes two Slam or Psychic Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Psychic Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 15, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of psychic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The doppelganger transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid it has seen or back into its true form, which is Monstrosity. Its statistics, other than its size and speed, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Read Thoughts
bonus_actions.description: The doppelganger magically reads the surface thoughts (what is foremost in the mind at the moment) of one creature within 60 feet of it. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, the doppelganger can continue reading the target’s thoughts until its concentration is broken (as if concentrating on a spell) or it uses Read Thoughts on a different target.

traits.description: The orca’s Perception is 18 when perceiving by hearing.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: The orca can hold its breath for 30 minutes.

actions.description: The orca makes two Bite attacks.

bonus_actions.name: Tail Slap
bonus_actions.description: The orca slaps one creature it can see within 15 feet of it with its tail. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the orca and knocked prone. A creature that fails this save by 5 or more is also stunned until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The feral hunter is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Heightened Senses
traits.description: The feral hunter’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by sight, hearing, or smell.

traits.name: Precise
traits.description: A weapon that deals piercing damage deals one extra die of its damage when the feral hunter hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Woodland Walk
traits.description: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the feral hunter extra movement. In addition, the feral hunter can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The feral hunter makes two Hunting Knife or Longbow attacks.

actions.name: Hunting Knife
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Mark Quarry
bonus_actions.description: The feral hunter marks one creature it can see within 30 feet of it as its quarry until the start of the feral hunter’s next turn. When the feral hunter hits the marked creature with a weapon attack, the weapon deals an extra 1d6 damage of the weapon’s type to the target.

reactions.name: Reposition
reactions.description: When the feral hunter takes damage, it can move up to 10 feet without provoking reactions.

traits.name: Glide
traits.description: The owlbear has long, sturdy feathers along its forelimbs and sides that expand while falling to slow its rate of descent to 60 feet per round, landing on its feet and taking no falling damage. It can move up to 5 feet horizontally for every 1 foot it falls. The owlbear can’t gain height with its gliding feathers alone. If subjected to a strong wind or lift of any kind, it can use the updraft to glide farther.

traits.name: Heightened Sight and Smell
traits.description: The owlbear’s Perception is 18 when perceiving by sight or smell.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The owlbear is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The owlbear makes one Beak attack and one Claws attack. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 15).

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Vicious Bound (44 HP or Fewer)
actions.description: The owlbear roars and barrels through creatures. It moves up to 20 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Medium or smaller creature. The first time it enters a creature’s space during this move, that creature must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 5 hits of bludgeoning damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Rend
bonus_actions.description: The owlbear violently wrenches a Medium or smaller creature it is currently grappling. The target must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 3 hits of slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.description: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.description: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: The target is restrained by webbing. A creature, including the restrained target, can take its action to free the target from the webbing by succeeding on a DC 13 FIT check. traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: The hag can mimic Animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 WIL (Insight) check.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts
traits.description: The hag can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hag makes two Claw or Torment attacks. If two attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 14 WIL save or be overwhelmed with pain and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Torment
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of psychic damage.

actions.name: Poisonous Allies (1/Day)
actions.description: The hag magically calls 1 giant spider, 2 giant poisonous snakes, or 2d4 poisonous snakes. They arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the hag and obeying its spoken commands. The creatures remain for 1 hour, until the hag dies, or until the hag dismisses them as a bonus action.

actions.name: Invisible Passage
actions.description: The hag magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage and can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment it wears or carries is invisible with it.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

bonus_actions.name: Illusory Appearance
bonus_actions.description: The hag covers itself and anything it is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes it look like another creature of its general size and Humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if the hag dies. 	 The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching it would feel its rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 INS (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hag can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Fey Resilience
traits.description: The hag is resistant to the charmed and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: The hag can mimic Animal sounds and Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 14 WIS (Insight) check.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts
traits.description: The hag can communicate with Beasts as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hag makes two Claw or Torment attacks. If two attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 14 WIS save or be overwhelmed with pain and have disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Torment
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) psychic damage.

actions.name: Poisonous Allies (1/Day)
actions.description: The hag magically calls 1 giant spider, 2 giant poisonous snakes, or 2d4 poisonous snakes. They arrive in 1d4 rounds, acting as allies of the hag and obeying its spoken commands. The creatures remain for 1 hour, until the hag dies, or until the hag dismisses them as a bonus action.

actions.name: Invisible Passage
actions.description: The hag magically turns invisible until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). While invisible, it leaves no physical evidence of its passage and can be tracked only by magic. Any equipment it wears or carries is invisible with it.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using CHA as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

bonus_actions.name: Illusory Appearance
bonus_actions.description: The hag covers itself and anything it is wearing or carrying with a magical illusion that makes it look like another creature of its general size and Humanoid shape. The illusion ends if the hag takes a bonus action to end it or if the hag dies. 	 The changes wrought by this effect fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, the hag could appear to have smooth skin, but someone touching it would feel its rough flesh. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 INT (Investigation) check to discern that the hag is disguised.

traits.name: Pounce
traits.description: If the dragon moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the dragon can make one Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and one Claw attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 13 FIT save, taking 8 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

traits.name: Prey Sense

traits.name: Unshakable Command
traits.description: Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the hobgoblin commander can’t be charmed or frightened while the commander isn’t incapacitated.

bonus_actions.name: Martial Tactics
bonus_actions.description: The hobgoblin commander employs one of the following tactics:

bonus_actions.name: –   Emboldening Shout
bonus_actions.description: One friendly creature within 30 feet of the hobgoblin commander that it can see gains 7 (2d6) temporary HP until the start of the commander’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Pressing Advance
bonus_actions.description: The commander moves up to half its speed and commands one friendly creature it can see within 30 feet of it to also move. The target can use its reaction to move up to half its speed in the direction of the commander’s choosing. This movement for both creatures is unaffected by difficult terrain and doesn’t provoke reactions.

ymiat.ac_notes: in humanoid form, 12 natural armor in wolf or hybrid form

traits.name: Heightened Hearing and Smell
traits.description: The werewolf’s Perception is 17 while perceiving by hearing or smell.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The werewolf has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the werewolf’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: The werewolf makes three Claws or Spear attacks. It can  replace one attack with a Bite attack, provided it is in  the appropriate form.

actions.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be cursed with the werewolf lycanthropy curse (see Curse of Lycanthropy sidebar).

actions.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear (Humanoid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 15 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The werewolf transforms into a Medum or Large wolf, a Medium wolf-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, speed, and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Hungry Growl (Wolf and Hybrid Form Only)
bonus_actions.description: The werewolf stares down and growls at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. The werewolf has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the frightened creature.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The insatiable brood has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Bites
traits.description: The insatiable brood’s Bites attacks are magical.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The insatiable brood deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Swarm
traits.description: The insatiable brood can occupy another creature’s space and vice versa, and the brood can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny creature. The brood can’t regain HP or gain temporary HP.

traits.name: Swarm Resilience
traits.description: The swarm is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, and it is immune to the charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, and stunned conditions.

traits.name: Void Dweller
traits.description: The insatiable brood doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep, and it is immune to the effects of Void terrain. In addition, it can fly through the Void as if through air.

actions.name: Bites
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 0 ft., one creature in the swarm’s space. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of force damage, or 2 hits of piercing damage plus 3 hits of force damage if the insatiable brood has half its HP or fewer.

bonus_actions.name: Void Gaze
bonus_actions.description: The insatiable brood turns all its individual heads in one direction, and its hundreds of Void-filled eyes stare at one creature the brood can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. If the target fails the save by 5 or more, it suffers a random, short-term dread effect for 1 minute.

traits.name: Martial Adept
traits.description: A manufactured weapon, such as a sword or bow, deals one extra die of its damage when the wight hits with it (included in the attack).

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the wight has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 8 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The wight doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The wight is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The wight makes two Longsword or Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a Life Drain attack.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 2 hits of necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or its HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

actions.name: – A Humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight’s control, unless the Humanoid is restored to life or its body is destroyed
actions.description: The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save or 17 to save if used with two hands, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 15 to save, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Command Horde
actions.description: The wight commands up to five friendly skeletons or zombies to do one of the following:

actions.name: –   Protect
actions.description: Until the start of the wight’s next turn, each time a friendly creature within 5 feet of a target is attacked, the target can use its reaction to intercept the attack, becoming the target instead.

actions.name: –   Overwhelm
actions.description: Until the start of the wight’s next turn, each target has advantage on attack rolls against a creature on its turn if at least one other target is within 5 feet of the creature and the allied target isn’t incapacitated.

actions.name: –   Shamble
actions.description: Each target uses its reaction to move up to its speed in a direction chosen by the wight. If this movement provokes an reactions, that attack is made with disadvantage.

bonus_actions.description: The target has disadvantage on weapon attack rolls made with that limb.

traits.name: Chivalrous Presence
traits.description: The knight exudes a powerful presence. At the start of each of the knight’s turns, it chooses one of the following presences, which lasts until the start of the knight’s next turn.

traits.name: –   Empowering Presence
traits.description: Each friendly creature that starts its turn within 15 feet of the knight has advantage on the first attack roll it makes before this presence ends.

traits.name: –   Protective Presence
traits.description: Hostile creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against friendly creatures within 5 feet of the knight.

traits.name: –   Unwavering Presence
traits.description: Each friendly creature within 15 feet of the knight is resistant to the charmed and frightened conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The knight makes three Greatsword attacks, or it makes four Javelin attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Javelin
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Champion’s Challenge
bonus_actions.description: The knight challenges one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that aren’t the knight until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The kobold swiftblade makes two Scimitar or Hand Crossbow attacks.

actions.name: Scimitar
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Hidden Scurry
bonus_actions.description: The swiftblade moves up to 15 feet without provoking reactions, and if it moves into a lightly or heavily obscured area, it takes the Hide action, using its Stealth value as the result of the check. If the swiftblade is aware of traps in the area, it can choose if this movement triggers any of them.

traits.name: Mimicry
traits.description: The manticore can mimic Humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful DC 13 WIL (Insight) check.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The manticore is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Tail Spike Regrowth
traits.description: The manticore has twenty-four tail spikes. Used spikes regrow when the manticore finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The manticore makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes two Tail Spike attacks. If both Tail Spike attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

actions.name: Tail Spike

traits.name: Charge
traits.description: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 hits of piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the minotaur and knocked prone.

traits.name: Labyrinthine Recall
traits.description: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The minotaur is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Reckless
traits.description: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage  until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The minotaur deals double damage  to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The minotaur makes one Gore attack and one Greataxe attack.

actions.name: Gore
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Greataxe
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Bleeding Frenzy (44 HP or Fewer)
bonus_actions.description: The minotaur enters a frenzy until the start of its next turn. Until the frenzy ends, the minotaur deals an extra 1 hit of damage of the weapon’s type each time it hits with a melee weapon attack, and the minotaur takes an extra 3 (1d6) damage of the weapon’s type the first time it is hit with a melee weapon attack before the frenzy ends.

ymiat.resistances: If the tarrasque fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.
ymiat.immunities: fire, poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks | charmed, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned

traits.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
traits.description: If the tarrasque fails a save, it can choose to succeed instead.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The tarrasque has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The tarrasque is resistant to exhaustion.

traits.name: Reflective Hide
traits.description: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

traits.name: Siege Behemoth
traits.description: The tarrasque deals triple damage to objects and structures.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The tarrasque uses its Frightful Presence. It then makes one Bite attack, four Claw attacks, and one Spiked Tail attack, or it makes five Acid Spit attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 32 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 27 FIT save or be swallowed by the tarrasque. A swallowed creature is blinded and restrained, it has total cover against attacks and other effect outside of the tarrasque, and it takes 12 hits of acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque’s turns.

actions.name: – If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a DC 20 CON save at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall prone in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque
actions.description: If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer restrained by it and can escape from the corpse using 20 feet of movement, exiting prone.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 30 to save, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Spiked Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 30 to save, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage and 4 hits of piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 27 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Acid Spit
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 24 to save, range 100/400 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of acid damage.

actions.name: Frightful Presence
actions.description: Each creature of the tarrasque’s choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 27 WIL save or be frightened for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature’s save is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque’s Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

legendary_actions.name: Detect
legendary_actions.description: The tarrasque automatically detects every creature and trap within 60 feet of it, pinpointing the current location of each.

legendary_actions.name: Move
legendary_actions.description: The tarrasque moves up to its speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Attack
legendary_actions.description: The tarrasque makes one Tail attack.

legendary_actions.name: Tail Swipe (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The tarrasque whips its spiked tail in a wide arc, flailing it in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 27 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 13 hits of piercing damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

ymiat.immunities: acid, lightning, slashing | grappled | Ooze Resilience
ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The pudding can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Corrosive Form
traits.description: A creature that touches the pudding or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 hit of acid damage. Any nonmagical weapon made of metal or wood that hits the pudding corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If its penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal or wood that hits the pudding is destroyed after dealing damage. The pudding can eat through a panel of nonmagical wood or metal in its space that is up to 2 inches thick in 1 round.

traits.name: Ooze Nature
traits.description: The pudding doesn’t require sleep.

traits.name: Ooze Resilience
traits.description: The pudding is resistant to the restrained condition, and it is immune to exhaustion and to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, and prone conditions.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The pudding can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The black pudding makes two Pseudopod attacks.

actions.name: Pseudopod
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of acid damage. In addition, nonmagical armor worn by the target is partly dissolved and takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to the AC it offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 is destroyed.

bonus_actions.name: Dampen Light
bonus_actions.description: The black pudding dims the light around it. The radius of each light source within 60 feet of it is halved until the start of its next turn. The pudding can’t use this action while in sunlight.

reactions.name: Split
reactions.description: When a pudding that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new puddings if it has at least 10 HP. Each new pudding has HP equal to half the original pudding’s, rounded down. New puddings are one size smaller than the original pudding.

traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The chuul is resistant to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The chuul can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Sense Magic
traits.description: The chuul senses and can pinpoint the location of magic within 120 feet of it. If it senses magic and can see the creature or object bearing the magic it senses, it sees a faint aura around that creature or object.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The chuul makes two Pincer attacks.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is Large or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 14). The chuul has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Wild Reach (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The chuul taps into ancient memories of magic and reaches toward nearby magic with an unpracticed grasp, releasing a burst of energy. Each creature within 15 feet of the chuul must make a DC 14 FIT save, taking 6 hits of damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If a magic item, spell effect, or spellcaster is within 30 feet of the chuul, the burst is pure arcane energy, dealing force damage. If no magic is within 30 feet of the chuul, the burst pulls from the chuul’s own life force, dealing necrotic damage. If the damage is necrotic, the chuul takes necrotic damage as if it succeeded on the save.

bonus_actions.name: Paralyzing Tentacles
bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the chuul must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is paralyzed. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the chuul must succeed on a DC 14 CON save or be poisoned for 1 minute. Until this poison ends, the creature is paralyzed. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

ymiat.resistances: The couatl has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Celestial Resilience
traits.description: The couatl is resistant to radiant damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks.

traits.name: Inscrutable
traits.description: The couatl is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as divination spells or effects, such as scrying or detecting its location, that it refuses. WIL (Insight) checks made to ascertain the couatl’s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The couatl has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The couatl’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The couatl makes one Bite attack and one Constrict attack.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage. If the poison damage reduces the target to 0 HP, the couatl can choose for the target to be stable but poisoned for 1 hour, even after regaining HP, and is unconscious while poisoned in this way.

actions.name: Constrict
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is a Medium or smaller creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the couatl can’t Constrict another target.

actions.name: Healing Hiss (3/Day)
actions.description: The couatl croons a soothing hiss at a creature it can sense within 5 feet of it. The target magically regains 10 (3d6) HP and is freed from any disease or poison.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The couatl magically transforms into a Large or smaller Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Celestial. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the couatl’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the couatl retains its Celestial Resilience and Inscrutable traits and its HP, HD, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action and the Rainbow Shield reaction. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

reactions.name: Rainbow Shield
reactions.description: When a creature the couatl can see within 30 feet of it, including itself, is targeted with an attack, the couatl can interpose a shield of rainbow-hued light between the attacker and the creature. The attacker has disadvantage on the attack roll. If the protected creature hasn’t attacked or harmed another creature within the last minute, the attacker’s attack misses instead.

actions.name: Stomp

bonus_actions.name: Trunk Grab
bonus_actions.description: The elephant grabs one Large or smaller creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be grappled (escape DC 15). The elephant can grapple only one creature at a time.

traits.name: Trampling Charge

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The ettin is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.description: The ettin has two heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Obstinate
traits.description: The ettin has advantage on WIL and WIL saves.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.description: When one of the ettin’s heads is asleep, its other head is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ettin makes one Knobbed Club attack and one Spiked Club attack.

actions.name: Knobbed Club
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn, as the blow knocks the wind out of the target. This weapon is wielded by the right head.

actions.name: Spiked Club
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute, as bits of rotten meat clinging to the club’s spikes coat the target’s wound. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. This weapon is wielded by the left head.

bonus_actions.name: That One! One of the ettin’s heads picks a creature the ettin can see within 30 feet of it, gaining advantage on its next attack against that creature
bonus_actions.description: The other head doesn’t like being told what to do and has disadvantage on its next attack against that creature. Each weapon attack notes which head controls that weapon.

ymiat.immunities: cold, necrotic | charmed, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: any languages it knew in life

traits.name: Ethereal Sight
traits.description: The ghost can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material Plane, and vice versa.

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The ghost can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 2 hits of force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The ghost doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The ghost is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Unfinished Business
traits.description: Unless its unfinished business is fulfilled, a destroyed ghost returns in 1d4 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again within 10 feet of where it died. If presented with an object or piece of information related to its unfinished business, the ghost must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn. After it has been incapacitated by a particular source, the ghost can’t be incapacitated by that same source again for 24 hours. If presented with everything it needs to complete its unfinished business, the ghost permanently dies after completing it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ghost makes two Withering Touch or Telekinetic Throw attacks.

actions.name: Withering Touch
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Telekinetic Throw
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 15 to save, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, depending on the type of object thrown. The ghost can throw only Small or smaller objects within range that aren’t being worn or carried.

actions.name: Horrify (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The ghost speaks a haunting phrase, reveals the wounds from its death, or performs some other expression to scare creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 14 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 6 hits of psychic damage and is frightened until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t frightened. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more increases its age in years by 10 percent, rounded up. This aging can be reversed with a greater restoration spell or similar magic, but only within 24 hours of the aging occurring.

bonus_actions.name: Etherealness
bonus_actions.description: The ghost enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Ethereal Plane, and vice versa, yet it can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

ymiat.resistances: The husk demon has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Amorphous
traits.description: The husk demon can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The husk demon is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The husk demon has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The husk demon makes two Life Drain attacks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage, and the husk demon regains HP equal to half the necrotic damage dealt. The target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or its HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creatures finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

bonus_actions.name: Soul Feed
bonus_actions.description: The husk demon feasts on the light in the soul of up to two creatures it can see within 20 feet of it, causing one of the following effects. Each target must succeed on a DC 15 WIL save or suffer the chosen effect. A creature that fails the save against Soul Feed two rounds in a row suffers one level of exhaustion.

bonus_actions.name: –   Happiness Feast
bonus_actions.description: The husk demon feasts on the target’s happiness, causing the target to become crestfallen. The target has disadvantage on attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Hope Feast
bonus_actions.description: The husk demon feasts on the target’s hope, causing the target to become despondent. The target has disadvantage on saves until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Motivation Feast
bonus_actions.description: The husk demon feasts on the target’s motivation, causing the target to lose its ambitions and become apathetic. The target’s speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Warlord’s Rally (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The warlord yells a rallying cry to its allies. Each friendly creature within 30 feet of the warlord that can hear the warlord has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the warlord’s next turn.

traits.name: Telepathic Bond
traits.description: The succubus ignores the range  restriction on its telepathy when communicating with  a creature it has charmed. The two don’t even need  to be on the same plane of existence.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The succubus makes two Claw attacks or  one Claw attack and one Draining Kiss attack. It can  replace one attack with Charm.

actions.name: Claw (Fiend Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of psychic damage.

actions.name: Draining Kiss
actions.description: Melee Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 18, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is charmed, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 4 hits of psychic damage, and the target’s HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

actions.name: Charm
actions.description: One Humanoid the succubus can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 WIL save or be magically charmed for 1 day, until the succubus dies, or until the succubus takes a bonus action to end the effect. The charmed target obeys the succubus’s verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the save, ending the effect on itself on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this succubus’s Charm for the next 24 hours. 	 The succubus can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

actions.name: Change Shape
actions.description: The succubus transforms into a Small or Medium Humanoid or back into its true form, which is Fiend. Without wings, it loses its flying speed. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

actions.name: Etherealness
actions.description: The succubus magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

reactions.name: Defend Me, Love!
reactions.description: When a creature the succubus can see within 5 feet of a creature charmed by the succubus attacks the succubus, the succubus can command the charmed creature to use its reaction to make one melee weapon attack against the attacker.

ymiat.ac_notes: in humanoid form, 11 natural armor in boar or hybrid form

traits.name: Charge (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.description: If the wereboar moves at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a Slam or Tusks attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2 hits of damage of the weapon’s type. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone.

traits.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
traits.description: If the wereboar takes 14 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 HP, it is reduced to 1 HP instead.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: The wereboar makes three Maul or Slam attacks. It can replace one attack with a Tusks attack, provided it is in the appropriate form. If two Maul or Slam attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Maul (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Slam (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Tusks (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 12 FIT save or be cursed with the wereboar lycanthropy curse (see Curse of Lycanthropy sidebar).

bonus_actions.name: Challenging Snort (Boar or Hybrid Form Only)
bonus_actions.description: The wereboar snorts and stomps its feet at a creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 13 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn and have disadvantage on the next save it makes against being knocked prone by the wereboar.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The wereboar transforms into a Medum or Large boar, a Medium boar-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, speed, and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

traits.name: Pounce (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
traits.description: If the weretiger moves at least 15 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the weretiger can make one Bite or Claw attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: The weretiger makes four Claw or Scimitar attacks, or it makes four Longbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack, provided it is in the appropriate form.

actions.name: Bite (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or be cursed with the weretiger lycanthropy curse (see Curse of Lycanthropy sidebar).

actions.name: Claw (Tiger or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Scimitar (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 16 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Longbow (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 15 to save, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Bleed Prey
bonus_actions.description: The weretiger chooses a creature it can see within 30 feet of it to be its prey until the prey dies, until the weretiger dies, or until the weretiger uses this bonus action on another creature. While within 60 feet of its prey, the weretiger can pinpoint its prey’s location. In addition, if the weretiger hits the prey with at least two melee weapon attacks, the weretiger rends the prey’s flesh, and the prey must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or lose 7 (2d6) HP at the start of its next turn, as the wound bleeds excessively.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The weretiger transforms into a Large tiger, a Medium tiger-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. traits.name: Aberrant Resilience
traits.description: The otyugh is resistant to the charmed,

traits.name: frightened, paralyzed, and stunned conditions, and it has advantage on saves against spells or effects that would alter its form
Limited Telepathy
traits.description: The otyugh can magically transmit simple messages and images to any creature within 120 feet of it that can understand a language. This form of telepathy doesn’t allow the receiving creature to telepathically respond.

traits.name: Stench
traits.description: Each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the otyugh must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The otyugh makes one Bite attack and two Tentacle attacks. It can replace both Tentacle attacks with a use of Tentacle Slam.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or become infected with a disease. Until the disease is cured, the target is poisoned. Every 24 hours that elapse, the infected creature must repeat the save, reducing its HP maximum by 5 (1d10) on a failure. The disease is cured on a success. The creature dies if the disease reduces its HP maximum to 0. This reduction to the creature’s HP maximum lasts until it finishes a long rest after the disease is cured.

actions.name: Tentacle
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, it is grappled (escape DC 13). The otyugh has two tentacles, each of which can grapple one target.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam
actions.description: The otyugh slams creatures grappled by it into each other or into a solid surface. Each creature must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of bludgeoning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

actions.name: Tentacle Slam

On a failure, a creature takes 14 (4d6) bludgeoning damage and is stunned until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t stunned.

traits.name: Air Form
traits.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Cloud Camouflage
traits.description: The elemental’s Stealth is 20 while in clouds, fog, or windy weather.

traits.name: Elemental Nature
traits.description: The elemental doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Elemental Resilience
traits.description: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled,  paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained,  and unconscious conditions.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The elemental makes two Wind Lash or Lightning Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Wind Lash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Lightning Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 19 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of lightning damage.

actions.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: Each creature in the elemental’s space must make a DC 13 FIT save. On a failure, a target takes 5 hits of bludgeoning damage and is flung up 20 feet away from the elemental in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: If the save is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn’t flung away or knocked prone

reactions.name: Thunderous Retreat
reactions.description: When a creature the air elemental can see deals damage to it, the elemental can expel a crack of thunder and move up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Each creature within 5 feet of the space the elemental left must succeed on a DC 13 FIT save or take 2 hits of thunder damage.

traits.name: Climbing Tendrils
traits.description: If at least four of the roper’s Grasping Tendrils aren’t grappling creatures, the roper has a climbing speed of 30 feet.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the roper remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal conical or spire-like cave formation, such as a stalagmite or stalactite.

traits.name: Grasping Tendrils
traits.description: The roper can have up to six Grasping Tendrils at a time. Each Grasping Tendril can be attacked (AC 20; 10 HP; vulnerable to thunder damage; immune to poison and psychic damage). Destroying a Grasping Tendril deals no damage to the roper, which can extrude a replacement tendril on its next turn. A Grasping Tendril can also be broken if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 FIT check against it.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The roper is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The roper can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to  make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The roper makes one Bite attack and three Grasping Tendril attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Grasping Tendril
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 50 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and has disadvantage on FIT checks and FIT saves, and the roper can’t use the same Grasping Tendril on another target. A creature immune to the poisoned condition doesn’t have disadvantage on FIT checks and FIT saves from the tendril.

bonus_actions.name: Reel
bonus_actions.description: The roper pulls each creature grappled by it up to 25 feet straight toward it.

reactions.name: Snapping Tendril
reactions.description: When a Grasping Tendril that is grappling a creature is destroyed, the roper can quickly pull the remains of that tendril back to it with a whipping snap. Each creature within 10 feet of the roper must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be knocked prone.

ymiat.resistances: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Barbed Death
traits.description: When the barbed devil dies, its body withers, leaving behind a mass of spikes on the ground in a 10-foot radius centered on the devil’s body. The area becomes difficult terrain for 1 minute, and when a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d6 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels.

traits.name: Barbed Hide
traits.description: A creature that hits the barbed devil with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 hit of piercing damage. A creature that starts its turn grappling or grappled by the barbed devil takes 1 hit of piercing damage.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Tail attack, or it makes three Hurl Flame attacks.
