actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Tail attack, or it makes three Hurl Flame attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage.

actions.name: Hurl Flame
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) fire damage. If the target is a flammable object that isn’t being worn or carried, it also catches fire.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 1 hit of fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.description: When the salamander hits with a metal melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 2 hits of fire damage (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The salamander makes one Trident attack and one Tail attack, or it makes three Fire Bolt attacks. It can replace one Trident attack with a Tail attack.

actions.name: Trident
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage. If the target is wielding a weapon or shield, it must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or drop the weapon or shield (the salamander’s choice if the target is wielding both).

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can’t make tail attacks against other targets.

actions.name: Fire Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, ranged 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of fire damage.

actions.name: Tighten Grip
actions.description: The salamander tightens its grip around one creature it is grappling. Until the start of the salamander’s next turn, the target has disadvantage on any check made to escape the grapple, and other than a successful check to escape the grapple, the target can’t be moved, knocked prone, or otherwise removed from the salamander’s grasp without the salamander’s permission.

traits.name: Heated Body
traits.description: A creature that touches the salamander or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

traits.name: Heated Weapons
traits.description: When the salamander hits with a metal melee weapon, the weapon deals an extra 7 (2d6) fire damage (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The salamander makes one Trident attack and one Tail attack, or it makes three Fire Bolt attacks. It can replace one Trident attack with a Tail attack.

actions.name: Trident
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage, or 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack, plus 7 (2d6) fire damage. If the target is wielding a weapon or shield, it must succeed on a DC 14 DEX save or drop the weapon or shield (the salamander’s choice if the target is wielding both).

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage plus 7 (2d6) fire damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the salamander can automatically hit the target with its tail, and the salamander can’t make tail attacks against other targets.

actions.name: Fire Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, ranged 60 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (3d6 + 2) fire damage.

actions.name: Tighten Grip
actions.description: The salamander tightens its grip around one creature it is grappling. Until the start of the salamander’s next turn, the target has disadvantage on any check made to escape the grapple, and other than a successful check to escape the grapple, the target can’t be moved, knocked prone, or otherwise removed from the salamander’s grasp without the salamander’s permission.

traits.name: Artistic Expression
traits.description: The bard has one primary form of artistic expression, such as song, poetry, dance, fashion, paint, or similar. It is resistant to one type of damage associated with that artistic expression. For example, a bard expressing art through song or oration is resistant to thunder damage, a bard expressing art through paint is resistant to acid or poison damage (the bard’s choice), and a bard expressing art through witty discourse or clever quips is resistant to psychic damage. This trait can’t make the bard resistant to force, necrotic, or radiant damage.

traits.name: Expressive Weapons
traits.description: When the bard hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 damage of the type determined by Artistic Expression.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The bard makes two Rapier or Hand Crossbow attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Rapier
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5. ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage of the type determined by Artistic Expression.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: + 6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 4 hits of damage of the type determined by Artistic Expression.

actions.name: Dissonant Outburst (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: Each creature within 30 feet of the bard and that can see or hear it must make a DC 15 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of thunder damage and 2 hits of psychic damage and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn’t have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The bard casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15).

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: + 6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) piercing damage plus 13 (3d8) damage of the type determined by Artistic Expression.

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.description: Whenever the shambling mound is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and regains HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The shambling mound is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and  unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Rotting Vegetation
traits.description: The shambling mound emits the  smell of rotting vegetation. A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the shambling mound must succeed on  a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its  next turn.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The shambling mound makes two Slam attacks. If both attacks hit a Medium or smaller target, the target is grappled (escape DC 14).

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

bonus_actions.name: Engulf
bonus_actions.description: The shambling mound engulfs a Medium or smaller creature grappled by it. In addition to being grappled, the engulfed target is blinded, restrained, and unable to breathe, and it must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save at the start of each of the mound’s turns or take 1 hit of bludgeoning damage and 1 hit of poison damage. If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

If the mound moves, the engulfed target moves with it. The mound can have only one creature engulfed at a time.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The bulette is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.description: The bulette’s long jump is up to 30 feet and its high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The bulette makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Deadly Leap (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The bulette leaps up to 30 feet, diving onto a point it can see or sense within that range and landing on its feet with a thunderous crash. It occupies a space of its choice within 5 feet of that point, and each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of bludgeoning damage and 4 hits of thunder damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone. Any creature in the bulette’s space is then pushed into an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the bulette. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls prone in the bulette’s space.

bonus_actions.name: Seek Prey
bonus_actions.description: The bulette looks and sniffs around for new prey, releasing a satisfied, guttural chirp when it settles on one. One creature the bulette can see or sense within 30 feet of it and that can see or hear the bulette must make a DC 15 WIL save. On a failure, the target is frightened until the end of its next turn, and the bulette has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against the creature before the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Blood Frenzy
traits.description: The shark has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn’t have all its HP.

traits.name: Blood Sense
traits.description: The shark can pinpoint, by scent, the location of creatures that don’t have all of their HP within 120 feet of it and can sense the general direction of such creatures within 1 mile of it.

traits.name: Electrical Sensitivity
traits.description: Whenever the shark takes lightning damage, it must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Water Breathing
traits.description: The shark can breathe only underwater.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The shark makes two Bite attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Swift Hunter
bonus_actions.description: The shark moves up to half its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target not grappled by the crocodile. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Death Roll
bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the crocodile must make a DC 16 FIT save, taking 2 hits of slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Tail

traits.name: Hardy
traits.description: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

traits.name: Trampling Charge
traits.description: If the triceratops moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the triceratops can make one Stomp attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The triceratops makes two Gore attacks.

actions.name: Gore
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Stomp
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one prone creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Warning Bugle
bonus_actions.description: The triceratops emits a piercing call in a 30-foot cone, signaling its impending attack. Each creature in the area must succeed on a DC 14 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its next turn. If the triceratops uses this bonus action before moving the requisite 20 feet for Trampling Charge, the target of its charge has disadvantage on this save, and the triceratops can make a Stomp attack against the prone target without needing to use a bonus action, provided the target fails the FIT save from the charge.

traits.name: Earthen Camouflage
traits.description: The elemental’s Stealth is 14 while in muddy, rocky, sandy, or stony terrain.

traits.name: Elemental Nature
traits.description: The fire elemental doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Elemental Resilience
traits.description: The fire elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Fire Camouflage
traits.description: The fire elemental’s Stealth is 18 while in a Medium or larger fire.

traits.name: Fire Form
traits.description: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 hits of fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage and catch fire; until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 2 hits of fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.description: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility
traits.description: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The elemental makes two Fiery Touch or Spit Fire attacks.

actions.name: Fiery Touch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 2 hits of fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Spit Fire
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of fire damage.

bonus_actions.name: Fiery Dash (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The elemental moves up to 20 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature without provoking reactions. Each space along that line catches fire until the start of the elemental’s next turn. A creature that enters a burning space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or take 2 hits of fire damage.

A creature that touches the elemental or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 (1d10) fire damage. In addition, the elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature’s space on a turn, that creature must succeed on a DC 14 DEX save or take 5 (1d10) fire damage and catch fire; until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the burning creature takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

traits.name: Illumination
traits.description: The elemental sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

traits.name: Water Susceptibility
traits.description: For every 5 feet the elemental moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The elemental makes two Fiery Touch or Spit Fire attacks.

actions.name: Fiery Touch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 (1d10) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

actions.name: Spit Fire
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d8 + 3) fire damage.

bonus_actions.name: Fiery Dash (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The elemental moves up to 20 feet in a straight line and can move through the space of any Large or smaller creature without provoking opportunity attacks. Each space along that line catches fire until the start of the elemental’s next turn. A creature that enters a burning space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 14 DEX save or take 5 (1d10) fire damage.

ymiat.resistances: The unicorn has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Celestial Resilience
traits.description: The unicorn is resistant to radiant damage.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The unicorn has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The unicorn’s weapon attacks are magical.

traits.name: Sense the Unnatural
traits.description: The unicorn can pinpoint the location of Aberrations and Undead within 60 feet of it.

traits.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
traits.description: The unicorn can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Woodland Walk
traits.description: Difficult terrain composed of nonmagical plants doesn’t cost the unicorn extra movement. In addition, the unicorn can pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The unicorn makes one Hooves attack and one Horn attack, or it makes two Horn Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Hooves
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Horn
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of radiant damage.

actions.name: Horn Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of radiant damage.

actions.name: Unicorn Magic
actions.description: The unicorn can cast the dancing lights and druidcraft cantrips at will, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability.

actions.name: Healing Touch (3/Day)
actions.description: The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) HP and is freed from all curses, diseases, and poisons afflicting it.

reactions.name: Shimmering Shield
reactions.description: When a creature the unicorn can see within 30 feet of it, including the unicorn, is attacked, the unicorn can surround it with a shimmering shield of radiant light. The target adds 3 to its AC against the attack.

legendary_actions.name: Canter
legendary_actions.description: The unicorn moves up to half is speed without provoking reactions.

legendary_actions.name: Radiant Stomp (Costs 2 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The unicorn raises its hooves glowing with golden light and brings them down with a reverberating stomp. Each hostile creature within 10 feet of the unicorn must make a DC 14 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 3 hits of radiant damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone.

legendary_actions.name: Heal Self (Costs 3 Actions)
legendary_actions.description: The unicorn magically regains 11 (2d8 + 2) HP.

ymiat.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: Aversion of Fire
traits.description: If the golem takes fire damage, it loses its immunity to the frightened condition and has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Berserk (55 HP or Fewer)
traits.description: When the golem starts its turn, roll a d6. On a 6, the golem goes berserk. On each of its turns while berserk, the golem attacks the nearest creature it can see. If no creature is near enough to move to and attack, the golem attacks an object, with preference for an object smaller than itself. Once the golem goes berserk, it continues to do so until it is destroyed or regains all its HP. 	 The golem’s creator, if within 60 feet of the berserk golem, can try to calm it by speaking firmly and persuasively. The golem must be able to hear its creator, who must take an action to make a DC 15 WIL (Persuasion) check. If the check succeeds, the golem ceases being berserk. If the golem takes damage while still at 55 HP or fewer, the golem might go berserk again.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Flesh Golem Resilience
traits.description: The golem is immune to poison damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Lightning Absorption
traits.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to lightning damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the lightning damage dealt.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Creator’s Anguish (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The golem releases a wave of emotional anguish from its core. Each creature within 15 feet of the golem must make a DC 15 WIL save. On a failure, a creature takes 9 hits of psychic damage and is incapacitated until the end of its next turn, as its mind fills with memories of its greatest failures. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t incapacitated.

ymiat.resistances: . The unska has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The unska is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The unska has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The unska makes two Claw attacks and one Tongue attack, or it makes three Ink Blast attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. While poisoned, the target has disadvantage on saves against the unska’s Whirl of Ink. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Tongue
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save, or its HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if its HP maximum is reduced to 0.

actions.name: Ink Blast
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 3 hits of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or have disadvantage on the next save it makes against the unska’s Whirl of Ink before the start of the unska’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Whirl of Ink
bonus_actions.description: Tattoos leap off the unska’s body and latch onto a creature the unska can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 WIL save or be charmed, disoriented, or frightened (the unska’s choice) until the end of its next turn. When a disoriented creature moves, it moves in a random direction.

traits.name: Brutal
traits.description: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the gladiator hits with it (included in the attack).

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The gladiator makes two Shield Bash attacks and two Spear attacks, or it makes three Spear attacks.

actions.name: Shield Bash
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be knocked prone.

actions.name: Spear
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Entertaining Display
bonus_actions.description: The gladiator slams its spear against its shield, twirls its spear, or roars while flexing, entertaining or intimidating up to two creatures it can see within 15 feet of it. Each target must succeed on a DC 15 WIL save or be charmed or frightened (the gladiator’s choice) until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The gladiator adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the gladiator must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

traits.name: Hungry Dead Nature
traits.description: As the vampire.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The vampire spawn regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP and isn’t in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn’t function at the start of the vampire’s next turn.

traits.name: Resting Place
traits.description: As the vampire.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: As the vampire

traits.name: Vampire Weaknesses
traits.description: As the vampire.

traits.name: Vampiric Resilience
traits.description: The vampire is immune to exhaustion.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vampire spawn makes two Claw attacks. It can replace one attack with a Draining Bite attack. If both Claw attacks hit one Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 14).

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Draining Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is grappled by the vampire, incapacitated, or restrained. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage. The target’s HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains HP equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

bonus_actions.name: Call Blood
bonus_actions.description: The vampire calls to the blood within one injured creature it can see within 10 feet of it, causing blood to pour from the creature’s wounds. If the target doesn’t have all its HP, it must make a DC 14 FIT save, losing 7 (2d6) HP on a failed save, or losing half as much HP on a successful one. Before the end of its next turn, the vampire has advantage on the next attack roll it makes against a creature that failed the save.

traits.description: If the gorgon moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the gorgon can make one Hooves attack against it as a bonus action.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The gorgon makes one Gore attack and one Hooves attack.

actions.name: Gore
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Hooves

actions.name: Petrifying Breath (Recharge 5-6)

On a failure, a creature takes 6 hits of poison damage and is restrained as it begins to turn to stone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t restrained. A restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn. On a success, the effect ends on the creature. On a failure, the creature is petrified until freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

traits.name: Elemental Nature
traits.description: The elemental doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Elemental Resilience
traits.description: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Freeze
traits.description: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes, and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Purify Water
traits.description: If the water elemental sits in a body of slow-flowing or standing water, such as a spring, small creek, or lake, for at least 1 hour, the water becomes purified and rendered free of poison and disease. In slow-flowing water, this purification fades 1 hour after the elemental leaves the water. In standing water, this purification lasts until a contaminant enters the water while the elemental isn’t in it.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Water Camouflage
traits.description: The water elemental’s Stealth is 17 while in a Medium or larger body of water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The water elemental makes two Water Tendril or Water Bolt attacks. If both Water Tendril attacks hit one creature, it can use Whelm on the target, if available.

actions.name: Water Tendril
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is Large or smaller. The water elemental can have up to three targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Water Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 16 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whelm (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: The water elemental envelops one creature it is grappling, and the grapple ends. While enveloped, the target is restrained, unable to breathe unless it can breathe water, can’t be hit by the elemental’s Water Tendril, and it takes 3 hits of bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the elemental’s turns.

actions.name: – When the elemental moves, the enveloped creature moves with it
actions.description: The elemental can have only one creature enveloped at a time. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental, including the target, can take its action to free the target from the elemental by succeeding on a DC 15 FIT check.

bonus_actions.name: Purify Blood (3/Day)

traits.description: The elemental is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Freeze
traits.description: If the elemental takes cold damage, it partially freezes, and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the end of its next turn.

traits.name: Purify Water
traits.description: If the water elemental sits in a body of slow-flowing or standing water, such as a spring, small creek, or lake, for at least 1 hour, the water becomes purified and rendered free of poison and disease. In slow-flowing water, this purification fades 1 hour after the elemental leaves the water. In standing water, this purification lasts until a contaminant enters the water while the elemental isn’t in it.

traits.name: Water Form
traits.description: The elemental can enter a hostile creature’s space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

traits.name: Water Camouflage
traits.description: The water elemental’s Stealth is 17 while in a Medium or larger body of water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The water elemental makes two Water Tendril or Water Bolt attacks. If both Water Tendril attacks hit one creature, it can use Whelm on the target, if available.

actions.name: Water Tendril
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15) if it is Large or smaller. The water elemental can have up to three targets grappled at a time.

actions.name: Water Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Whelm (Recharge 4-6)
actions.description: The water elemental envelops one creature it is grappling, and the grapple ends. While enveloped, the target is restrained, unable to breathe unless it can breathe water, can’t be hit by the elemental’s Water Tendril, and it takes 9 (2d8) bludgeoning damage at the start of each of the elemental’s turns.

actions.name: – When the elemental moves, the enveloped creature moves with it
actions.description: The elemental can have only one creature enveloped at a time. A creature within 5 feet of the elemental, including the target, can take its action to free the target from the elemental by succeeding on a DC 15 STR check.

bonus_actions.name: Purify Blood (3/Day)
bonus_actions.description: The water elemental touches a willing creature that isn’t a Construct or Undead. The target is cured of the poisoned condition and of any disease afflicting it.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The hill giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Show of Might
traits.description: The hill giant can use FIT instead of WIL when making WIL (Intimidation) checks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Spiked Tree Branch or Rotten Snack attacks.

actions.name: Spiked Tree Branch
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Rotten Snack
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 19 to save, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Body Bounce
bonus_actions.description: The hill giant bumps its stomach, hip, shoulder, knee, or other part of its body into a creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the giant and knocked prone.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The hill giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Show of Might
traits.description: The hill giant can use STR instead of CHA when making CHA (Intimidation) checks.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Spiked Tree Branch or Rotten Snack attacks.

actions.name: Rotten Snack

bonus_actions.name: Body Bounce

traits.name: Heightened Smell
traits.description: The werebear’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The werebear makes three Claw or Greataxe attacks. It can replace one attack with a Bite attack, provided it is in the appropriate form. If two Claw attacks hit one creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 15). The werebear can grapple only one creature at a time.

actions.name: Bite (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be cursed with the werebear lycanthropy curse (see Curse of Lycanthropy sidebar).

actions.name: Claw (Bear or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The werebear transforms into a Medum or Large bear, a Large bear-humanoid hybrid, or back into its true form, which is Humanoid. Its statistics, other than its size, speed, and AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn’t transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Pin
bonus_actions.description: One creature grappled by the werebear is knocked prone, and it is restrained until the grapple ends.

actions.name: Greataxe (Humanoid or Hybrid Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (1d12 + 5) slashing damage.

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Collective Mind
traits.description: The hivebound’s individual insects and swarms under its control are connected via a hive mind. It can telepathically communicate with any of its individual insects and swarms within 1 mile of it, and it can’t be surprised. It can have up to five swarms of insects under its control at a time.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The hivebound is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Reinforced Mind
traits.description: If the hivebound starts its turn afflicted by an ongoing effect that allows a repeated INS, WIL, or WIL save to end the effect, such as the hold spell, the hivebound can make the save at the start of the turn instead of the end and has advantage on the save.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hivebound makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes three Spit Insect attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Spit Insect
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be pestered until the end of its next turn. A pestered creature has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the pester ends.

actions.name: Swarm Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The hivebound exhales stinging insects in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 3 hits of piercing damage and 5 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. A swarm of insects under the hivebound’s control then forms in an unoccupied space in that area.

bonus_actions.name: Swift Flight
bonus_actions.description: The hivebound flies up to half its speed without provoking reactions.

ymiat.immunities: necrotic | charmed, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained | Undead Resilience
ymiat.languages: the languages it knew in life

traits.name: Incorporeal Movement
traits.description: The wraith can move through other

traits.name: creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain
traits.description: It takes 2 hits of force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the wraith has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The wraith doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The wraith is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The wraith makes two Life Drain attacks.

actions.name: Life Drain
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or its HP maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0.

actions.name: Create Specter
actions.description: The wraith targets one Humanoid it can see within 10 feet of it that has been dead for no longer than 1 minute and died violently. The target’s spirit rises as a specter in the space of its corpse or in the nearest unoccupied space. The specter is under the wraith’s control. The wraith can have no more than seven specters under its control at one time.

bonus_actions.name: Trail of Death (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The wraith moves up to 30 feet in a straight line. This distance is not reduced by moving through creatures or objects, and this movement doesn’t provoke reactions. The first time it enters a creature’s space during this move, that creature must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be afflicted with wasting doom. While afflicted with wasting doom, a creature takes 1 hit of necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns. Wasting doom ends if a creature starts its turn in sunlight or regains HP.

reactions.name: Unravel Life
reactions.description: When a creature the wraith can see within 30 feet of it and that isn’t a Construct or Undead regains HP, the wraith can corrupt the healing energies, halving the amount of healing that creature receives.

traits.name: Pack Tactics
traits.description: The kobold has advantage on attack rolls against a creature if at least one of the kobold’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t incapacitated.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 7 when perceiving by sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The kobold witch makes three Eldritch Burst attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Eldritch Burst
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 18, reach 5 ft. or range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of force damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The kobold witch casts one of the following spells, using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 15).

bonus_actions.name: Scurry
bonus_actions.description: The kobold moves up to 15 feet without provoking reactions. If the kobold is aware of traps in the area, the kobold can choose if this movement triggers any of them.

bonus_actions.name: Witch’s Cauldron
bonus_actions.description: The kobold witch ladles steaming brew out of a small cauldron it is holding and flings the substance at one friendly creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target gains 5 (2d4) temporary HP until the start of the witch’s next turn.

reactions.name: Hex
reactions.description: When a creature the kobold witch can see within 60 feet of it makes an ability check, attack roll, or save, the target must roll a d6 and subtract the number rolled from that ability check, attack roll, or save.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: The xorn’s Stealth is 18 while in rocky terrain.

traits.name: Treasure Sense
traits.description: The xorn can pinpoint, by scent, the location of precious metals and stones, such as coins and gems, within 60 feet of it.

actions.name: Lob Stone
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Shard Belch
bonus_actions.description: The xorn belches a mixture of stomach gas and crystalline shards in a 15-foot cone. A creature coated in shards suffers bouts of pain each time it moves, reducing its speed by 10 feet and imposing disadvantage on all weapon attack rolls.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The mire fiend is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance

traits.name: Pack Tactics

traits.name: Swamp Camouflage
traits.description: The mire fiend’s Stealth is 21 while in swampy terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The mire fiend makes one Mandibles attack, one Spear attack, and one Stinger attack.

actions.name: Mandibles
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Spear

actions.name: Stinger
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned.

actions.name: Stunning Snap (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: If the mire fiend has no creature grappled, it snaps its mandibles together with great force, creating a miniature sonic boom in a 30-foot cone. ymiat.resistances: The hag has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The hag has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The night hag can use Cause Sorrow. It then makes two Claw or Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one Claw or Arcane Bolt attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw (Hag Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Arcane Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 hits of force damage.

actions.name: Cause Sorrow
actions.description: One creature the hag can see within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 WIL save or be filled with sorrow for 1 minute. While filled with sorrow, a creature is incapacitated and experiences visions or memories of sorrowful events. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns (if conscious) or end of each hour (if unconscious), ending the effect on itself on a success. 	 For each hour an unconscious creature is affected, its HP maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). This reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic. The creature dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0. If an unconscious creature suffers from Cause Sorrow for at least 1 hour, it doesn’t gain any benefits from the rest.

actions.name: – The hag can have only one creature filled with sorrow at a time
actions.description: If it uses Cause Sorrow on another, the effect on the previous creature ends.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The hag magically transforms into Medium or smaller Humanoid, or back into its true form, which is Fiend. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Etherealness
bonus_actions.description: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. The hag can use Cause Sorrow on an unconscious creature not on its plane; otherwise, the hag can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

original.resistances: The hag has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The hag has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The night hag can use Cause Sorrow. It then makes two Claw or Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one Claw or Arcane Bolt attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Claw (Hag Form Only)
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) slashing damage.

actions.name: Arcane Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (3d10 + 3) force damage.

actions.name: Cause Sorrow
actions.description: One creature the hag can see within 10 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 CHA save or be filled with sorrow for 1 minute. While filled with sorrow, a creature is incapacitated and experiences visions or memories of sorrowful events. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns (if conscious) or end of each hour (if unconscious), ending the effect on itself on a success. 	 For each hour an unconscious creature is affected, its HP maximum is reduced by 5 (1d10). This reduction lasts until removed by the greater restoration spell or similar magic. The creature dies if this effect reduces its HP maximum to 0. If an unconscious creature suffers from Cause Sorrow for at least 1 hour, it doesn’t gain any benefits from the rest.

actions.name: – The hag can have only one creature filled with sorrow at a time
actions.description: If it uses Cause Sorrow on another, the effect on the previous creature ends.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using CHA as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The hag magically transforms into Medium or smaller Humanoid, or back into its true form, which is Fiend. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

bonus_actions.name: Etherealness
bonus_actions.description: The hag magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. The hag can use Cause Sorrow on an unconscious creature not on its plane; otherwise, the hag can’t affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can’t speak

traits.name: Terrifying Luminance
traits.description: When a creature that can see the balara’s glowing ribcage starts its turn within 30 feet of the balara, the balara can force it to make a DC 14 WIL save if the balara isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. On a failure, the creature is frightened until the start of its next turn, as the visions, fear, and pain of the last moments of several animals flash through its mind. While frightened, the creature’s speed is reduced to 0, and it can’t use reactions.

traits.name: – Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn
traits.description: If the creature does so, it can’t see the balara until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the balara in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

traits.name: Undead Nature
traits.description: The balara doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Undead Resilience
traits.description: The balara is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the poisoned condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The balara makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks, or it makes three Necrotic Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage, and the target can’t regain HP until the start of the balara’s next turn.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of necrotic damage, and the target can’t regain HP until the start of the balara’s next turn.

reactions.name: Relentless Pursuit
reactions.description: When a creature the balara can see moves away from it, the balara can move up to half its speed toward that creature. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions.

traits.name: If the lion or goat head succumbs, the chimera has disadvantage on the next Bite or Headbutt attack it makes before the end of its next turn
traits.description: If the dragon head succumbs, creatures caught in the chimera’s next Fire Breath have advantage on the save, provided the chimera uses the breath within the next 1 minute. Once a head has succumbed to a desire, that head can’t succumb again for the next 24 hours.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The chimera is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.description: The chimera has three heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions.

actions.description: The chimera makes one Bite attack, one Headbutt attack, and two Claws attacks, or it can make two Claws attacks and use Fire Breath, if available.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
traits.description: The drider is resistant to the charmed condition, and magic can’t put the drider to sleep.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The drider is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The drider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
traits.description: While in sunlight, the drider has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 10 when perceiving by sight.

traits.name: Web Sense
traits.description: While in contact with a web, the drider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

traits.name: Web Walker
traits.description: The drider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The drider makes one Longsword attack and two Skewer attacks, or it makes three Web Shot attacks.

actions.name: Longsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save or 18 to save if used with two hands, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Skewer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage.

actions.name: Web Shot
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 18 to save, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be restrained by webbing. A creature, including the restrained target, can take its action to break the webbing and free the restrained target by succeeding on a DC 15 FIT check.

ymiat.languages: Auran, understands Common but can’t speak it

traits.name: Elemental Nature
traits.description: The invisible stalker doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Elemental Resilience
traits.description: The stalker is resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to poison damage, to exhaustion, and to the grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Faultless Tracker
traits.description: At the end of each long rest, the invisible stalker can choose a creature it knows or has seen to be its quarry. A stalker summoned by another creature can choose only the quarry specified by its summoner, but the stalker also knows the location of its summoner while it continues to serve the summoner. The stalker always knows the direction and distance to its quarry, provided the two are on the same plane of existence.

traits.name: Invisibility
traits.description: The stalker is invisible. The condition’s effect on FIT (Stealth) checks has been included in the above Stealth value.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The stalker makes two Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of cold damage. If the target is the stalker’s quarry, the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Steal Breath
bonus_actions.description: The invisible stalker calls on the air in the lungs of one breathing creature it can see within 30 feet of it, causing the air to leave the creature. The target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be unable to speak or cast spells with verbal components until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is also incapacitated and suffocating for the duration, as it  coughs uncontrollably.

traits.description: If the mammoth moves at least 20 feet straight toward a creature and then hits it with a Gore attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, the mammoth can make one Stomp attack against it as a  bonus action.

bonus_actions.name: Trunk Grab
bonus_actions.description: The mammoth grabs one Large or smaller creature within 10 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be grappled (escape DC 17). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the mammoth can’t use Trunk Grab on another creature.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The medusa is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Petrifying Gaze
traits.description: When a creature that can see the medusa’s eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a DC 14 FIT save if the medusa isn’t incapacitated and can see the creature. If the save fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly petrified. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is restrained. The restrained creature must repeat the save at the end of its next turn, becoming petrified on a failure or ending the effect on itself on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the greater restoration spell or other magic.

traits.name: Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the save at the start of its turn
traits.description: If the creature does so, it can’t see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save. 	 If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa, due to its curse, is affected by its own gaze. A medusa isn’t resistant to its own gaze.

traits.name: Snake Friend
traits.description: The medusa can communicate with snakes as if they shared a language, and snakes can’t be petrified by the medusa’s Petrifying Gaze.

actions.description: The medusa makes one Snake Hair attack and two Shortsword attacks, or it makes three Longbow attacks.

traits.description: The vrock is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.description: The vrock has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The vrock makes one Beak attack and two Talon attacks.

actions.name: Beak
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Talon
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Wing Spores (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The vrock shakes a cloud of toxic spores from its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of it must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 8 hits of poison damage and is poisoned for 1 minute. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t poisoned. While poisoned, a creature takes 1 hit of poison damage at the start of each of its turns. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. Emptying a vial of holy water on the poisoned creature also ends the effect on it.

actions.name: Startling Screech
actions.description: The vrock emits a horrific screech at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be able to take either an action or bonus action on its turn, not both, and it can’t take reactions.

traits.name: Suffocating Heat
traits.description: After the brass dragon uses its Fire Breath, the air around it is devoid of moisture and lacking in breathable air. While the dragon’s Fire Breath is unavailable, each creature that requires air to breathe, other than the dragon, and that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or begin suffocating. A creature that fails this save for two consecutive rounds falls unconscious until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Sleep Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales fire in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 FIT save, taking 10 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Sleep Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales sleep gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or fall unconscious for 1 minute. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.description: The dragon can move across and climb icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The ape makes two Fist or Rock attacks. If both Fist attacks hit one Large or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 16). The ape has two fists, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 19 to save, range 50/100 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Throw
bonus_actions.description: One Large or smaller creature grappled by the ape is thrown up to 50 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

actions.name: Multiattack

ymiat.senses: keensense 60 ft. (can’t sense beyond this radius)

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The golmana is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Heightened Hearing
traits.description: The golmana’s Perception is 19 when perceiving by hearing.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The golmana has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Spider Climb
traits.description: The golmana can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The golmana makes two Claws attacks and one Tail attack. If both Claws attacks hit a Medium or smaller creature, the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the golmana can’t make Claws attacks against other targets.

actions.name: Claws
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Void Screech (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The golmana lets out a keening screech in a 30-foot cone. Each creature that isn’t a Fiend in that area must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of necrotic damage and 5 hits of thunder damage, and it has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the start of the golmana’s next turn, as brief contact with the energies of the Void destabilizes the creature. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and doesn’t suffer this disadvantage on its next attack roll.

bonus_actions.name: Consuming Rend
bonus_actions.description: The golmana violently digs its small, torso claws into one creature it is grappling. The target must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 2 hits of slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The golmana then regains HP equal to the damage dealt.

traits.name: Tools of the Trade
traits.description: The master alchemist is proficient with

traits.name: alchemist’s supplies and doubles its proficiency bonus for any ability check it makes with alchemist’s supplies

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The master alchemist makes three Hasty Concoction attacks.

actions.name: Hasty Concoction
actions.description: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of acid, cold, fire, or poison damage (the alchemist’s choice). The concoction then causes one of the following effects of the master alchemist’s choice.

actions.name: –   Disorienting Vapors
actions.description: Overly sweet-smelling, pink vapors erupt from where the concoction hit the target. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must make a DC 15 INS save. When a creature that failed this save moves on its next turn, it moves in a random direction.

actions.name: –   Poisonous Cloud
actions.description: An acrid-smelling, green gas pours out from where the concoction hit the target. The gas fills a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on the target. The gas spreads around corners, and its area is lightly obscured. A creature that enters the gas for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn. The gas disperses at the start of the master alchemist’s next turn.

actions.name: –   Slick Floor
actions.description: A thick, purple foam bursts out from where the concoction hit the target. The floor within 10 feet of the target is coated in slick goop until the start of the master alchemist’s next turn, when the foam dries. For the duration, when a creature moves through the area, it must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or fall prone.

actions.name: When the master alchemist makes a Hasty Concoction attack, it can choose to target a point on the ground it can see within 60 feet instead
actions.description: If it does so, the concoction causes only one of the above effects centered on that point instead of dealing damage.

actions.name: Explosive Flask (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The master alchemist throws an explosive flask at a point it can see within 30 feet of it. Each creature within 10 feet of that point must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 9 hits of fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Healing Unguent (3/Day)
actions.description: The master alchemist rubs a greasy unguent on a creature’s wounds. The target regains 14 (4d6) HP.

bonus_actions.name: Protective Draught (Recharge 4-6)
bonus_actions.description: The master alchemist drinks one of its brews and gains resistance to acid, cold, fire, or poison damage (the master alchemist’s choice) until the end of its next turn.

traits.description: The oni’s weapon attacks are magical. When the oni hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d6 force damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The oni is resistant to the stunned condition.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The oni regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The oni makes two Claw or Glaive attacks, or it makes three Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

actions.name: Glaive

actions.name: Arcane Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 17, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of force damage.

If the oni dies, it reverts to its true form, and the glaive reverts to its normal size.

ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator and the languages of the wearer of its amulet but can’t speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.description: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet’s wearer, and the amulet’s wearer can telepathically call the guardian, teleporting the guardian to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the wearer after 1 minute. In addition, if the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet’s wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is taken by the guardian instead.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The shield guardian doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Construct Resilience
traits.description: The shield guardian is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The shield guardian regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.description: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian’s amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell, using the appropriate action required by the spell, with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The shield guardian makes two Runed Fist attacks, or it makes three Rune Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Runed Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of force damage.

actions.name: Rune Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 16, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 4 hits of force damage.

bonus_actions.name: Protective Step
bonus_actions.description: The guardian teleports up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space it can see within 5 feet of the amulet’s wearer.

reactions.name: Shield
reactions.description: When a creature the guardian can see makes an attack against the amulet’s wearer, the guardian grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s AC if the guardian is within 5 feet of the wearer.

original.languages: understands the languages of its creator and the languages of the wearer of its amulet but can’t speak

traits.name: Bound
traits.description: The shield guardian is magically bound to an amulet. As long as the guardian and its amulet are on the same plane of existence, the guardian knows the distance and direction to the amulet’s wearer, and the amulet’s wearer can telepathically call the guardian, teleporting the guardian to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the wearer after 1 minute. In addition, if the guardian is within 60 feet of the amulet’s wearer, half of any damage the wearer takes (rounded up) is taken by the guardian instead.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The shield guardian doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Construct Resilience
traits.description: The shield guardian is immune to poison and psychic damage, and it is immune to exhaustion and the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Regeneration
traits.description: The shield guardian regains 10 HP at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 HP.

traits.name: Spell Storing
traits.description: A spellcaster who wears the shield guardian’s amulet can cause the guardian to store one spell of 4th level or lower. To do so, the wearer must cast the spell on the guardian. The spell has no effect but is stored within the guardian. When commanded to do so by the wearer or when a situation arises that was predefined by the spellcaster, the guardian casts the stored spell, using the appropriate action required by the spell, with any parameters set by the original caster, requiring no components. When the spell is cast or a new spell is stored, any previously stored spell is lost.

actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d8) force damage.

actions.name: Rune Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +5 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (4d6 + 2) force damage.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The stone giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Stone Camouflage
traits.description: The giant’s Stealth is 20 while in rocky terrain.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Stony Fist or Rock attacks.

actions.name: Stony Fist
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 17) if it is a Large or smaller creature and the stone giant isn’t already grappling a creature.

actions.name: Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 21 to save, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or be knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Wrestle
bonus_actions.description: The stone giant performs one of the following wrestling maneuvers against one creature it is grappling. The target must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or suffer the listed effect until the stone giant uses this bonus action again or until the grapple ends.

bonus_actions.name: –   Armbar
bonus_actions.description: The target has disadvantage on attack rolls and on checks made to escape the grapple.

bonus_actions.name: –   Chinlock
bonus_actions.description: The target can’t speak and can’t cast spells with verbal components.

bonus_actions.name: –   Takedown
bonus_actions.description: The target is knocked prone and restrained.

bonus_actions.name: –   Throw
bonus_actions.description: The target is thrown up to 30 feet in a random direction and knocked prone, ending the grapple. If a thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 17 FIT save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

reactions.name: Missile Deflection
reactions.description: If a creature the giant can see makes a ranged weapon attack against the giant, the giant can add 3 to its AC. If the attack misses, the giant can catch the missile, provided the attack included a projectile, and throw it back at the attacker, using the giant’s normal ranged weapon attack bonus and the weapon’s normal damage.

traits.name: Acidic Vapors
traits.description: After the black dragon uses its Acid Breath, acid clings to its mouth, throat, and nostrils for a time, evaporating as the dragon breathes. While the dragon’s Acid Breath is unavailable, acidic vapors surround it, and each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales acid in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 15 hits of acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
