traits.name: Corrosive Scales
traits.description: When the copper dragon hasn’t spit its Acid Breath, the acid built up within the dragon causes the patina on its scales to spread to weapons that strike it. While the dragon’s Acid Breath is available, any weapon made of metal that hits the dragon corrodes. After dealing damage, the weapon takes a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to damage rolls. If a nonmagical weapon’s penalty drops to -5, the weapon is destroyed. Nonmagical ammunition made of metal that hits the dragon is destroyed after dealing damage. A magical weapon can’t have a penalty greater than -5, and a magical weapon removes this penalty after 24 hours or after its attuned wielder finishes a long rest.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Slowing Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Acid Breath (Recharge 5-6)

actions.name: Slowing Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: As the copper dragon wyrmling, except it is a 30-foot cone, and the save DC is 14.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

ymiat.languages: Thieves’ Cant plus any two languages

traits.name: Evasion
traits.description: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a FIT save to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the save, and only half damage if it fails.

traits.name: Poisoned Weapons
traits.description: The assassin’s weapons are coated in poison. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 3d8 poison damage (included in the attack). In addition, at the start of each of its turns, the assassin can choose which of the following poisons is active on its weapons. The poison remains on the weapons until the start of the assassin’s next turn.

traits.name: –   Assassin’s Friend
traits.description: A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison takes an extra 1 hit of poison damage each time it takes damage while poisoned.

traits.name: –   Buyer’s Mercy
traits.description: A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison falls unconscious while poisoned or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.

traits.name: –   Meddler’s Fate
traits.description: A creature poisoned by a weapon coated with this poison has its speed halved while poisoned.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The assassin makes three Shortsword or Hand Crossbow attacks.

actions.name: Shortsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 17 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Hand Crossbow
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Hidden Step
bonus_actions.description: The assassin magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and takes the Hide action.

ymiat.resistances: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes four Chain attacks.

actions.name: Chain
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of piercing damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 15). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 4 hits of piercing damage at the start of each of its turns, and the chain devil can’t use the same Chain on another target.

bonus_actions.name: Animate Chains
bonus_actions.description: The chain devil commands chains it can see within 60 feet of it that aren’t being worn or carried to grab up to two creatures it can see within 10 feet of at least one commanded chain. Each creature must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be restrained. A creature, including the restrained creature, can take its action to free the restrained creature by succeeding on a DC 15 FIT check.

bonus_actions.name: – The devil can have up to two creatures restrained in this way at a time
bonus_actions.description: If it uses this bonus action to restrain a third, the effect ends on one of the previous targets (the devil’s choice).

reactions.name: Unnerving Mask
reactions.description: When a creature the devil can see starts its turn within 30 feet of the devil, the devil can command its mask to shift to look like one of the creature’s departed loved ones or bitter enemies. If the creature can see the mask, it must succeed on a DC 15 WIL save or be frightened until the end of its turn.

traits.name: Damage Transfer
traits.description: While attached to a creature, the cloaker takes only half the damage dealt to it (rounded down), and that creature takes the other half.

traits.name: False Appearance
traits.description: While the cloaker remains motionless without its underside exposed, it is indistinguishable from a dark leather cloak.

traits.name: Light Sensitivity
traits.description: While in bright light, the cloaker has disadvantage on attack rolls, and its Perception is 6 when perceiving by sight.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The cloaker makes one Bite attack and two Tail attacks.

actions.name: Bite

If the cloaker has advantage on the attack roll, the cloaker attaches to the target’s head, and the target is blinded and unable to breathe while the cloaker is attached. While attached, the cloaker can’t make Bite attacks, and at the start of each of the cloaker’s turns, the target takes 5 hits of piercing damage.	 The attached cloaker moves with the target whenever the target moves, requiring none of the cloaker’s movement. It can detach itself by spending 5 feet of its movement on its turn. A creature, including the target, can take its action to detach the cloaker by succeeding on a DC 15 FIT check.

actions.name: Tail

actions.name: Moan (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The cloaker releases a deep, thrumming moan that rattles the nerves of all who hear it. The death knight has advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute after absorbing a soul.  	 The creature can’t be restored to life until the death knight is permanently destroyed.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The death knight makes three Greatsword or Necrotic Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage and 7 (2d6) necrotic damage.

actions.name: Necrotic Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: +7 to hit, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d6 + 4) necrotic damage.

bonus_actions.name: Champion’s Challenge
bonus_actions.description: The death knight challenges one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 CHA save or have disadvantage on attack rolls against creatures that aren’t the knight until the end of its next turn.

reactions.name: Parry
reactions.description: The death knight adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

reactions.name: Soul Drain
reactions.description: When the death knight reduces a Humanoid to 0 HP, it can absorb the creature’s soul. The target must succeed on a DC 15 WIS save or immediately die, its soul becoming trapped in the death knight’s sword. The death knight has advantage on attack rolls for 1 minute after absorbing a soul.  	 The creature can’t be restored to life until the death knight is permanently destroyed.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The frost giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Ice Walk
traits.description: The frost giant can move across icy surfaces without needing to make an ability check. In addition, difficult terrain composed of ice or snow doesn’t cost it extra movement.

traits.name: Snowsight
traits.description: The frost giant can see through areas obscured by snowfall, sleet, and other wintry precipitation without penalty.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The giant makes two Icy Greataxe or Ice Boulder attacks.

actions.name: Icy Greataxe
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Ice Boulder
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 18 to save, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Avalanche (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The frost giant sends out a wave of snow in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 4 hits of bludgeoning damage and 5 hits of cold damage and is buried. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t buried. A buried creature is restrained and unable to breathe or stand up. A creature, including the buried creature, can take its action to free the buried creature by succeeding on a DC 16 FIT check.

bonus_actions.name: Wintry Blast
bonus_actions.description: A blast of wintry air extends in a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide from the frost giant’s outstretched hand. Each creature in the line must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or its speed is halved until the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is petrified in ice for 1 hour or until a creature spends 1 minute warming the petrified creature.

ymiat.resistances: The hezrou has advantage

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The hezrou can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The hezrou is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The hezrou has advantage  on saving throws against spells and other  magical effects.

traits.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
traits.description: The hezrou can communicate with frogs and toads as if they shared a language.

traits.name: Standing Leap
traits.description: The hezrou’s long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Stench
traits.description: A creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the hezrou must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a success, the creature is immune to the hezrou’s Stench for the next 24 hours.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hezrou makes one Sticky Tongue attack, one Bite attack, and two Claw attacks.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Sticky Tongue
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 20 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be pulled up to 15 feet toward the hezrou.

bonus_actions.name: Quick Leap
bonus_actions.description: The hezrou jumps horizontally up to 20 feet to an unoccupied space it can see without provoking reactions.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: The hydra can hold its breath for 1 hour.

traits.name: Multiple Heads
traits.description: The hydra has five heads and is resistant to the blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, stunned, and unconscious conditions. 	 Whenever the hydra takes 25 or more damage in a single turn, one of its heads dies. If all its heads die, the hydra dies. At the end of its turn, it grows two heads for each of its heads that died since its last turn, unless it has taken fire damage since its last turn. The hydra regains 10 HP for each head regrown in this way.

traits.name: Reactive Heads
traits.description: For each head the hydra has beyond one, it gets an extra reaction that can be used only for reactions.

traits.name: Wakeful
traits.description: While the hydra sleeps, at least one of its heads is awake.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The hydra makes as many Bite attacks as it has heads.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Noxious Breath (Recharge Special)
actions.description: The hydra exhales poisonous gas in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 16 FIT save, taking 12 hits of poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. While the hydra has five or more heads, this action has a recharge of 6. The recharge range increases for each head the hydra has below five. For example, a hydra that starts its turn with two heads can recharge this feature on a 3, 4, 5, or 6.

bonus_actions.name: Bloody Burst (Has Fewer Than Five Heads)
bonus_actions.description: The hydra squeezes the stumps of its severed heads, spraying blood and gore. Each creature within 5 feet of the hydra must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be incapacitated until the end of its next turn and poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

traits.name: Hold Breath

While the hydra has five or more heads, this action has a recharge of 6. The recharge range increases for each head the hydra has below five. For example, a hydra that starts its turn with two heads can recharge this feature on a 3, 4, 5, or 6.

traits.name: Guardian Projection
traits.description: The spirit naga’s skeletal form is covered with a magical illusion that makes it look like the guardian naga it was in life. The naga can use a bonus action to dismiss this illusion until the end of its next turn. 	 The changes wrought by this illusion fail to hold up to physical inspection. For example, a creature touching the spirit naga would feel its rough, dry scales and exposed bones instead of the smooth, cool scales of a guardian naga. Otherwise, a creature must take an action to visually inspect the illusion and succeed on a DC 20 INS (Investigation) check to discern the spirit naga’s true appearance.

traits.name: Monstrosity Resilience
traits.description: The naga is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.

traits.name: Necrotic Strikes
traits.description: The naga’s weapon attacks are magical. When the naga hits with any weapon attack, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

traits.name: Rejuvenation
traits.description: If it dies, the naga returns to life in 1d6 days, regaining all its HP and becoming active again. Only a wish spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The spirit naga makes two Bite or Spit Poison attacks. If both attacks hit one creature, the target must succeed on a DC 14 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 18 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage and 5 hits of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spit Poison
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 17 to save, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of poison damage plus 1 hit of necrotic damage.

actions.name: Spellcasting
actions.description: The spirit naga casts one of the following spells, requiring only verbal components and using WIL as the spellcasting ability (spell save DC 14).

bonus_actions.name: Hidden Step
bonus_actions.description: The spirit naga magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see and takes the Hide action.

actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (3d4 + 3) poison damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

traits.name: Hardy
traits.description: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The tyrannosaurus makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack. It can’t make both attacks against the same target.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can’t Bite another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rending Shake
bonus_actions.description: While grappling a creature, the tyrannosaurus shakes its head, tearing at the creature. The grappled creature must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or take 2 hits of slashing damage and be thrown up to 20 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If the thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 1 hit of bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Hardy
traits.description: Any critical hit against the dinosaur becomes a normal hit.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The tyrannosaurus makes one Bite attack and one Tail attack. It can’t make both attacks against the same target.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 31 (4d12 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a Large or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the tyrannosaurus can’t Bite another target.

actions.name: Tail
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. Hit: 23 (4d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Rending Shake
bonus_actions.description: While grappling a creature, the tyrannosaurus shakes its head, tearing at the creature. The grappled creature must succeed on a DC 16 STR save or take 6 (1d12) slashing damage and be thrown up to 20 feet in a random direction and knocked prone. If the thrown target strikes a solid surface, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 16 DEX save or take the same damage and be knocked prone.

traits.name: Amphibious
traits.description: The dragon can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Lightning Extraction
traits.description: After the bronze dragon uses its Lightning Breath, its body begins recharging with lightning, pulling electricity from nearby creatures. While the dragon’s Lightning Breath is unavailable, each creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the dragon must make a DC 15 FIT save. On a failure, a creature can use either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The dragon makes one Bite attack and two Claw attacks. It can replace its Bite attack with a use of Repulsion Breath, if available.

actions.name: Bite
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Lightning Breath (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales lightning in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 FIT save, taking 15 hits of lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

actions.name: Repulsion Breath (Recharge 6)
actions.description: The dragon exhales repulsion energy in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the dragon.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

traits.name: Devil’s Sight
traits.description: Magical darkness doesn’t impede the devil’s darkvision.

traits.name: Devilish Resilience
traits.description: The devil is resistant to cold damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to fire damage and poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The devil has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The devil makes two Claw attacks and one Sting attack.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 19 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage.

actions.name: Sting
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of poison damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be poisoned for 1 minute. The target can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus_actions.name: Devilish Command
bonus_actions.description: The bone devil shouts one of the following commands at one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 15 WIL save or obey the command. A lesser devil, such as a barbed devil or lemure, has disadvantage on this save.

bonus_actions.name: –   Attack
bonus_actions.description: The target uses its reaction to make one melee or ranged attack (the devil’s choice) against one creature the target can see within its weapon’s range.

bonus_actions.name: –   Beg for Mercy
bonus_actions.description: The target immediately falls prone and can’t cast spells with verbal components on its next turn as it is magically compelled to speak pleas of mercy.

bonus_actions.name: –   Flee
bonus_actions.description: The target uses its reaction to move up to its speed directly away from the bone devil. This movement doesn’t provoke reactions, but the target doesn’t avoid damaging terrain, such as lava.

ymiat.resistances: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.
ymiat.languages: understands the languages of its creator

traits.name: Acid Absorption
traits.description: Whenever the golem is subjected to acid damage, it takes no damage and instead regains HP equal to the acid damage dealt.

traits.name: Construct Nature
traits.description: The golem doesn’t require air, food, drink, or sleep.

traits.name: Fire Weakness
traits.description: When the clay golem takes fire damage, its body temporarily hardens like baked clay. Until the end of its next turn, the golem’s speed is reduced by 10 feet, it can’t use Mold Hand, and its AC becomes 18.

traits.name: Golem Resilience
traits.description: The golem is immune to poison and psychic damage and to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks. In addition, it is immune to exhaustion and to the charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, and poisoned conditions.

traits.name: Immutable Form
traits.description: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The golem has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Magic Weapons
traits.description: The golem’s weapon attacks are magical.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The golem makes three Slam attacks.

actions.name: Slam
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as determined by Mold Hand. The target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or suffer an effect based on the type of damage: knocked prone (bludgeoning), pushed up to 10 feet away from the golem (piercing), or its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the end of its next turn (slashing).

actions.name: Haste (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: Until the end of its next turn, the golem magically gains a +2 bonus to its AC, has advantage on FIT saves, and can make a Slam attack as a bonus action.

bonus_actions.name: Mold Hand
bonus_actions.description: The clay golem molds its hand into the shape of a weapon or back into a hand. The golem’s Slam attack deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, depending on the type of weapon chosen, until the golem uses this bonus action again. For example, a hand shaped like an axe deals slashing damage.

traits.name: Cloudsight
traits.description: The cloud giant can see through areas obscured by clouds, fog, smoke, and steam without penalty.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The cloud giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

traits.name: Heightened Smell
traits.description: The cloud giant’s Perception is 22 when perceiving by smell.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The cloud giant makes three Cloud-Coated Mace attacks, or it makes two Wind Burst attacks.

actions.name: Cloud-Coated Mace
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 23 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of piercing damage plus 1 hit of cold damage.

actions.name: Wind Burst
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 19, range 150 ft., one target. Hit: 9 hits of bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be pushed up to 10 feet away from the cloud giant and knocked prone.

bonus_actions.name: Cloud Cover
bonus_actions.description: The cloud giant creates a 20-foot cube of clouds centered on a point it can see within 60 feet of it. The cube spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lasts for 1 minute, until the cloud giant dies, or until the cloud giant uses this bonus action again.

bonus_actions.name: Condense
bonus_actions.description: The cloud giant causes a 20-foot-radius sphere of cloud, fog, smoke, or steam centered on a point it can see within 60 feet of it to become as thick as mud, making the area difficult terrain for creatures moving through it. A creature that starts its turn in the hardened cloud must succeed on a DC 15 FIT save or be restrained until the start of its next turn. The cloud remains condensed for 1 minute, until the cloud giant dies, or until the cloud giant uses this bonus action again.

reactions.name: Cirrus Deflection
reactions.description: The cloud giant creates a bit of hardened cloud between it and an attacker, increasing the giant’s AC by 4. To do so, it must be able to see the attacker.

traits.name: Giant Attributes
traits.description: The fire giant is resistant to the stunned condition, and it is vulnerable to the prone condition.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The fire giant makes two Flaming Greatsword  or Lava Boulder attacks.

actions.name: Flaming Greatsword
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 22 to save,  reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Lava Boulder
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 19 to save, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage plus 1 hit of fire damage.

actions.name: Volcanic Burst (Recharge 5-6)
actions.description: The fire giant expels built-up heat from within itself, sending a blast of lava outward. Each creature within 15 feet of the fire giant must make a DC 16 FIT save. On a failure, a creature takes 11 hits of fire damage and is knocked prone. On a success, a creature takes half the damage and isn’t knocked prone. A creature that fails this save has disadvantage on the next save it makes against the giant’s Pyroclastic Surge before the start of the giant’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: Pyroclastic Surge
bonus_actions.description: A burst of volcanic gas and rock fragments flows in a 60-foot-line that is 5 feet wide from the fire giant’s outstretched hand. Each creature in the line must succeed on a DC 16 FIT save or be poisoned until the end of its next turn and pushed up to 15 feet away from the giant. A creature that fails the save by 5 or more is petrified in volcanic ash for 1 hour or until a creature spends 1 minute soaking the petrified creature in cool water.

actions.name: Lava Boulder

actions.description: The fire giant expels built-up heat from within itself, sending a blast of lava outward. Each creature within 15 feet of the fire giant must make a DC 16 DEX save. ymiat.resistances: The glabrezu has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Demonic Resilience
traits.description: The glabrezu is resistant to cold, fire, and lightning damage. In addition, it is immune to poison damage and to the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Magic Resistance
traits.description: The glabrezu has advantage on saves against spells and other magical effects.

traits.name: Point Blank Grappler
traits.description: When the glabrezu makes a Crackling Flame Bolt attack, it doesn’t have disadvantage on the attack roll from being within 5 feet of a hostile creature, provided it is grappling that creature.

actions.name: Multiattack
actions.description: The glabrezu makes two Claw attacks and two Pincer attacks, or it makes four Crackling Flame Bolt attacks. It can replace both Claw attacks with two Crackling Flame Bolt attacks.

actions.name: Claw
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 20 to save, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of slashing damage plus 1 hit of fire damage and 1 hit of lightning damage.

actions.name: Pincer
actions.description: Melee Weapon Attack: 21 to save, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it is grappled (escape DC 17). The glabrezu has two pincers, each of which can grapple only one target.

actions.name: Crackling Flame Bolt
actions.description: Ranged Spell Attack: Defense Save DC 18, range 60 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of fire damage plus 3 hits of lightning damage.

bonus_actions.name: Manipulating Whispers
bonus_actions.description: The glabrezu whispers in the mind of a creature it can see within 120 feet of it, encouraging the creature to commit wicked acts. The target must succeed on a DC 17 WIL save or succumb to one of the following urges:

bonus_actions.name: –   Boastful Stance
bonus_actions.description: The target is overcome with surety of its own battle prowess, momentarily letting down its guard. Creatures have advantage on attack rolls against the target until the start of the glabrezu’s next turn.

bonus_actions.name: –   Confirmation of Wealth
bonus_actions.description: The target is briefly overcome with the desire to confirm the amount and status of its valuables. It uses either an action or bonus action on its next turn (the glabrezu’s choice) to count and take stock of its valuables.

bonus_actions.name: –   Wrathful Strike
bonus_actions.description: Anger fills the target, and it immediately lashes out at those nearby. The target uses its reaction to make one melee weapon attack against a creature of the glabrezu’s choice within 5 feet of the target.

traits.description: While the treant remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal tree.

traits.name: Plant Resilience
traits.description: The treant is resistant to exhaustion and to the paralyzed, petrified, and unconscious conditions.

traits.name: Siege Monster
traits.description: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

traits.name: Speak with Plants
traits.description: The treant can communicate with Plants and nonmagical plants as if they shared a language.

actions.name: Multiattack

actions.name: Throw Rock
actions.description: Ranged Weapon Attack: 22 to save, range 60/180 ft., one target. Hit: 1 hit of bludgeoning damage.

actions.name: Animate Trees (1/Day)
actions.description: The treant magically animates 2 trees or 2d6 shrubs it can see within 60 feet of it. The trees use the statistics of an awakened tree, and the shrubs use the statistics of an awakened shrub. The animated plants act as allies of the treant, obeying its spoken commands. The plants remain for 1 hour, until the treant dies, or until the treant dismisses them as a bonus action.

The treant can target only creatures in contact with the ground and can’t target creatures in contact with a manufactured floor, such as the wooden floor of a building.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape

In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INS, WIL, and WIL scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

actions.description: As the silver dragon wyrmling, except it is a 30-foot cone, and the save DC is 17.

bonus_actions.name: Change Shape
bonus_actions.description: The dragon magically transforms into a Beast or Humanoid that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form, which is Dragon. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying transforms with it or is borne by the new form (the dragon’s choice). It reverts to its true form if it dies. In a new form, the dragon retains its HP, ability to speak, proficiencies, and INT, WIS, and CHA scores, as well as this bonus action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.
